title: Geotechnical Design Engineer / Tuas / Up to $5,500
company_info: We arrange your future! Our Consultants have more than 5 years of experience and our aim is to provide the best service for all our clients.
job_category: Building and Construction, Engineering, Environment / Health, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
✅Prepare Bill of Quantities, Soil Investigation, work with vendor & agency for finalization.
✅Evaluate Soil Investigation for accurate specification for design.
✅Prepare back up calculation & calculate Pile capacity for various soils/rock.
✅Test pile location plan/ Pile reinforcement calculations & drawing preparation.
✅Validate of pile capacity by Pile load test (Vertical / Lateral / Pull out).
✅Piled Raft design using latest design tools and theories.
✅Design using PLAXIS 2D Software for i.e Sheet pile /Diaphragm wall-struture/contiguous pile
✅Design of all components i.e Anchor capacity, water & structure design, modelling top-down method
✅Dewatering system design. (Well point, Drawdown calculations, Open dewatering).
✅Seepage control techniques like Jet -Grouting, slurry wall & flow net calculations.
✅Soil improvement using stone column
✅Design of stone columns, settlement calculations & Liquefaction calculations.
✅Swelling soil management techniques.
✅Back Fill material specifications & various compaction techniques used for different back fill materials.
✅Slope stability calculations and analysis

Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree/Diploma in Civil Engineering
Min 5 years experience in Geotechnical design
Experience in analysis & design tools like PLAXIS 2D/3D, SLOPE/W, A-PILE & L-PILE


Interested applicants, please send in your updated resume by clicking “Apply Now”

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job posting for Singapore location

#hiring
#singaporejobs
#singaporeans
#Projectmanager



Company Overview
Our client is a n European company specialized in testing, inspection and certification founded in 1828. It operates in a variety of sectors, including building and infrastructure (27% of revenue), agri-food and commodities (23% of revenue), marine and offshore (7% of revenue), industry (22% of revenue), certification (7% of revenue) and consumer products (14% of revenue).
It is present in 140 countries through a network of over 1,500 offices and laboratories, and 84,000 employees. It generated €5.65 billion in revenue in 2022.

Job highlight
Ø Working opportunity with a well-known & established European company
Ø Job status: Project based Contract job| 5.5-days’ work week
Ø Bugis location
Ø High Salary | Nearby MRT station

Responsibilities
· To review (with calculations) the Contractor’s design, supervise and co-ordinate all aspects for the mining works.
· To ensure that the construction is carried out in accordance with the design, all relevant standards, contract specifications, approved method
· To prepare and develop detailed supervision schedule and comprehensive checklist for the conduct of the inspection and excavation construction activities associated with the micro-tunneling and mining works. This shall include at critical interfaces with adjacent important structures such as MRT and Tunnel, Road Flyover and Canal.
· To review construction drawings, method statements and construction sequence for all aspects of the temporary and permanent works of the micro-tunneling and mining works. Their interface with the cut-and-cover tunnels, modification proposals to the design and construction methods.
· To follow-up and supervise all modification at every stage of the mining construction including excavation, concreting, installation of support/stabilizing elements, casting of concrete and all other works to achieve the full completion of the tunnel in a safe manner.
· To conduct daily review meeting on site with the civil contractors, Qualified Person and Geotechnical Instrumentation and Monitoring contractor. He shall ensure that geotechnical and tunneling data are synchronized for optimal and safe tunneling
· To prepare reports to preserve the knowledge and experience gained from the project, addressing all aspects of the micro-tunneling and future improvements.

Requirement
· Degree in Civil Engineering or Building Construction
· Relevant technical certifications will be advantageous
· 10 years of relevant experience in supervising mining and micro tunnelling works in the civil projects
· Expertise in the management ofthe overall Project schedule
· Skill in Handlingdisputes or differences that may arise between the Company and the EPC Contractors or other parties in association with the Project and assist in settling them.
· Proven skills in maintainingand providing records and documentation for the Project and handover the consolidated document and as-built drawings (as approved by the relevant Government Agency(ies)) to the Company upon completion of the Project
· Time management and organization skill
· Excellent communication skill in English and local languages (Chinese, Mandarin, Bahasa Melayu, Tamil, etc.) to communicate with the stakeholders and vendors easily.
· Negotiation skills | Risk analysis skill| High level of business acumen
· Possess good attitude, Proactive
· Project Management skill will be advantageous
· Able to work independently.

Project Schedule / Work Details
· Nature of Project: Buildings & Infrastructure
· Starting date & duration: Will be advised on later date
· Working location: Bugis area
· Working days: 5.5 days’ work week
· Working hours: 8.30am – 5.30pm (will be confirmed on later date)
· Annual, Medical Leave, Insurances, Employer CPF, etc will be covered.

Salary & Benefits
· Monthly basic salary: SGD $7k-8K
· Annual: 12 days
· Medical Leave: 14 days
· Medical Insurances, Employer CPF, etc. will be covered.

NB: No quotas for the foreigners please. Singaporeans /SPRs only due to quota issue.

title: Account Risk Engineer - Construction
company_info: AIG APAC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD. American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States. AIG Property Casualty is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises. AIG Life and Retirement is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security. United Guaranty Corporation is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S. Additional information about AIG can be found at www.aig.com | YouTube: www.youtube.com/aig | Twitter: @AIG_LatestNews | LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/aig
job_category: Building and Construction, Engineering, Insurance, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance in approximately 70 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets and manage risks.
Finally, we’re also committed to making a positive difference for our colleagues and in the communities where we work and live. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.
Get to know the business
Risk Consulting at AIG is about teamwork! It is about utilizing your resources, working together to solve real world problems, and making a positive impact on our client’s futures. When asked, “why do we enjoy what we do?” The answer is simple, the people.
The role of an Account Risk Engineer is critical to what we do at AIG, both as a risk management resource to our clients and as an advisor to our global insurance organization. Account Risk Engineers are responsible for working with our internal and external business partners to identify and mitigate risks during construction and/or erection projects.
Looking for variety and a challenge? Client’s range in size, scope and complexity. One day you may be discussing the risk quality of a new construction project with your underwriter, the next, surveying a bridge, tunnel, dam, high-rise or other project to ensure proper design verity good construction practices are in place. The key to success isn’t about being the expert for every project, it’s about building trust and cross-functional relationships with stakeholders through effective communication. You will tap into your strong analytical skills, utilize internal and external guidelines, and leading-edge tools and methodologies to develop your view of an risk. Need that occupancy expertise after all? We have a Technical Integration Group as well as a vast team with years of experience to provide training, mentorship, and collaboration.
About the role
What you need to know:
Perform construction-all-risk (CAR) reviews of new builder risk projects by reviewing, interpreting, and summarizing third party technical risk information.
Provide global risk selection guidance to Underwriters to support profitable underwriting for Construction (CAR) accounts.
Manage the survey programs of Construction clients, including service plan development & report reviews.
Complete internal and market report writing in an accurate and timely fashion using AIG report formats, loss estimation methods & software, and AIG risk rating tools.
Where necessary, define testing and commissioning reporting requirements to demonstrate readiness for transfer from construction to operational insurance cover
Conduct on-site project reviews and develop market reports
Conduct client service meetings with underwriting, broker and client
Identify risk improvements opportunities for projects and work with the client to prioritize and implement them
Estimate of the cost of engineering services
Analyze the loss prevention attributes of a project including:Reviewing methods of construction
Review management best practices inclusive of water mitigation, security, ignition source control, etc.
Identify occupancy hazards and assess the adequacy of their protection features
Identify and assess the impact of external exposures on a facility
Determine fire and natural catastrophe loss estimates for a facility
What we’re looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering
Minimum five (5) years’ experience in the Construction industry and/or construction Insurance Industry

title: Research Engineer, TCOMS
company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
company_info: About Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description:
1. Perform research in the following areas:
a. Offshore hydrodynamics
b. Loads, motions and response analysis of Marine & Offshore platforms and floating structures
c. Fluid-structure interactions
2. Assist in conducting physical model tests, field experiments and numerical simulations to support the development of integrated physical-numerical modelling and simulations.
3. Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to contribute to grant proposals for research funding consistent with the strategic goals of TCOMS.
4. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirements:
Qualification & Field of Study:
Bachelor’s/Master’s Degree from reputable universities in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Ocean Engineering, Marine Engineering, Offshore Engineering, Physical Oceanography, Applied Mathematics, or other related disciplines.
Work Experience:
1. Preferably having relevant research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas:
2. Offshore engineering, marine engineering, hydrodynamics, naval architecture and ocean engineering.
3. Prior knowledge in the following numerical methods/software/programming languages will be an advantage:
a. CAD software such as SolidWorks, Rhino, AutoCAD
b. Engineering tools such as WAMIT, SESAM and OrcaFlex
c. Programming codes such as FORTRAN, Python, MATLAB, C++ or equivalent.
Other Requirements:
1. Good interpersonal and communications skills.
2. Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team.
3. Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

At the heart of our four-generation family-run business lies a proud heritage of industry, integrity and enterprise, focused on creating lasting value for our clients, improving quality and safety standards on every project, and maximising opportunities for our employees to achieve their career potential. These values have fueled the company’s growth consistently for more than 80 years, and continue to do so. In our efforts to continuously raise the industry bar, we seek to introduce innovative new building solutions and broaden our skills through strategic joint-venture partnerships with overseas counterparts. This has seen us emerge in recent years from being a principal player in the building of private residential and commercial developments, to becoming a leader too in large-scale civil engineering works, cementing our position at the forefront of the construction industry, locally and regionally.

title: Research Engineer (Structural Health Management), TCOMS
company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
company_info: About Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description:
· Join a team to develop a ship structural health management system via digital twin technology.
· Conduct FE modelling and structural analysis of marine and offshore structures, e.g., global, and local strength analysis, S-N curve based spectral fatigue assessment, fatigue remaining life evaluation based on fracture mechanics.
· Research and develop the risk-based structural health assessment framework and tools.
· Assist in conducting physical model tests, field experiments and numerical simulations to support the development of integrated physical-numerical modelling and simulations.
· Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to contribute to grant proposals for research funding consistent with the strategic goals of TCOMS.
· Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirements:
Qualification & Field of Study:
Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Naval Architecture, Ocean Engineering, or equivalent.
Work Experience:
· Must have solid knowledge on Finite Element, Ship Structural Mechanics, Naval Architecture, etc.
· Preferably having relevant research/industry experience with competent knowledge in CAD, FE modelling, First Principal Structural Analysis, LEFM, concept and basic design of marine and offshore structures.
· Prior knowledge in following numerical methods/software/programming languages will be an advantage:
o CAD software such as SolidWorks, Rhino, AutoCAD.
o FE analysis package such as FEMAP, SESAM, ABS DLA/SFA, BV Homer, etc.
o Programming codes such as C++, FORTRAN, Python, MATLAB, Unity3D or equivalent.
Other Requirements
· Candidate with high motivation to develop new skills preferred.
· Good interpersonal and communications skills.
· Good organization skills and ability to adapt and work effectively as team player.
· Curious, resourceful, and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Research Engineer, Fluid-Structure Interactions, TCOMS
company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
company_info: About Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Job description
1. Perform research in the following areas relating to coastal protection and adaptation to climate change:
- Wave attenuation over mangroves, seagrasses and coral reefs
- Feasibility of floating wetlands
2. Conduct literature review, field surveys and liaise with relevant government agencies to establish configurations of coastal vegetation/coral which are representative of those commonly found in Singapore.
3. Assist in planning and executing physical modelling and simulations involving free-surface waves interacting with artificial coastal vegetation/corals, as well as waves interacting with floating wetlands.
4. Perform numerical modelling and simulations using Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and relevant tools for validation with model test results, and subsequently conduct parametric study and interface with other research partners.
5. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirements
Qualification & Field of Study:
Bachelor/Master's Degree in Coastal Engineering, Civil/Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture, Ocean Engineering or other related disciplines.
Work Experience:
1. Preferably having relevant research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas:
- Coastal engineering, civil engineering and/or naval architecture.
2. Prior experience/knowledge of the following software/programming languages will be preferred:
- CAD software such as SolidWorks, Rhino, and/or AutoCAD
- CFD tools such as OpenFOAM, and/or StarCCM+
- Hydrodynamic analysis tools such as SESAM, OrcaFlex and/or WAMIT
- Data analysis tools such as MATLAB
- Programming languages such as python, C++ and/or FORTRAN
3. Experience with model tests in wave flumes or basins, including experimental design, model setup, sensing and data acquisition, will be an advantage.
Other Requirements:
- Good interpersonal and communications skills.
- Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team.
- Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Headquartered in Singapore, Sembcorp leverages its sector expertise and global track record to deliver innovative solutions that support the energy transition and sustainable development. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose and Scope
Direct report to the Project Manager, work, responsible as a site engineer or site supervisor, who is also a Sembcorp Competent Person (SCP) to manage and supervise site works and ensure all aspects of the site works are aligned with the project schedule, scope of work and obligations as required under the Contract.

Key Roles and Responsibilities
Support the Project Manager on monitoring the site works progress and when necessary to expedite the site works progress to meet the project schedule
Responsible as a Sembcorp Competent Person (SCP) to apply for and receive Permit To Work (PTW) and is qualified to supervise the execution of the work.
To check, review and enforce Contractor’s site works are inline with the scope of works and update the Project Manager daily on the site works progress.
To ensure the Permit-to-Work (PTW) are applied in advance as per Sembcorp HSE requirements and the PTW to be issued expeditiously by O&M team for the Contractor to commence their work
Work closely with the relevant parties to ensure approval of document prior to site work such as Method Statement and Risk Assessment (MSRA), PTW application etc, to ensure the document is reviewed, amended, discussed and agreed with all relevant stakeholders including the O&M team.
During construction, to review and provide input to RFI or engineering deliverables such as drawing, ITP etc for any corrective actions required
Work closely with the QA/QC engineer(s) to enforce the quality of works at site and are aligned with the QA/QC quality plan and other documentation such as blowing/Purging/Cleaning procedures, hydrostatic testing procedures, etc.
To ensure the site work is compliance to applicable company codes & standards, safety practices, QA/QC policies and meeting performance specification during the Site Acceptance Testing (SAT), commissioning and testing.
Any other necessary duty as assigned.
Qualifications & Experience
Diploma or Degree in respective discipline Engineering (process, chemical, electrical, mechanical, piping, Control & Instrumentation or Civil &Structural), project management, or equivalent tertiary education
At least 5-10 years of experience in petrochemical or refineries, process plant, power utilities, or water industries in projects management environment. Familiar with EPC working environment in Singapore.
Attended and passed examination of WSQ Supervise Workplace Safety and Health in Process Plant (previously known as OPISCS) conducted by WDA-ATP or similar, or equivalent industry recognized external course.
Attended courses and/or training including but not limited to
PTW Procedure
Hot Work
Lifting
Excavation
Radiography
Working-at-Height
Confined Space
Lift Saving Role (LSR)
Lock-out-tag-out (LOTO)
Safety Induction Course (SIC)
Skills/competencies & Preferred Characteristics
Possesses good communication (oral) and written skills
Possess at least a Class 3 driving license for adhoc situations would be an advantage as the projects are located in Jurong Island.
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitude, teamwork, analytical, communication skill, leadership skill.
Can work independently with minimum supervision.
Positive attitude with high self motivation to deliver the outcome
Good stakeholder management skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The job scope and responsibilities of a BIM engineer
Model Creation and Management: Developing 3D models using BIM software (such as Autodesk Revit) to accurately represent the physical and functional characteristics of the building or infrastructure project.
Coordination and Collaboration: Collaborating with architects, engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to integrate their designs and ensure interdisciplinary coordination. This involves resolving clashes or conflicts between different building systems and disciplines.
Information Integration: Collecting, organizing, and integrating various data sources into the BIM model, including architectural, structural, mechanical, and electrical information. This ensures that the model contains all the necessary information for the project's lifecycle.
Quantification and Analysis: Extracting quantities, such as material quantities and costs, from the BIM model to facilitate cost estimation and scheduling. Conducting analysis, simulations, and clash detection to identify potential issues and optimize the design.
Documentation and Visualization: Creating 2D drawings, construction documents, and visualizations from the BIM model for presentation and communication purposes. This includes generating plans, sections, elevations, and renderings.
BIM Standards and Workflows: Adhering to industry standards and established BIM protocols within the organization. Ensuring consistency, accuracy, and quality control of the BIM deliverables
The requirements for a BIM engineer typically include:
Education and Qualifications: A bachelor's degree in architecture, civil engineering, construction management, or a M&E related field is usually required.
BIM Software Proficiency: Strong knowledge and experience with BIM software, such as Autodesk Revit, Autodesk Navisworks, or Bentley Systems' OpenBuildings Designer. Familiarity with other software, such as AutoCAD and BIM collaboration tools, is also beneficial.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in 3D modeling, clash detection, and data extraction from BIM models. Knowledge of parametric modeling, family creation, and scripting languages (e.g., Dynamo, Python) can be advantageous.
Construction and M&E Design Knowledge: Understanding of construction techniques, building systems, Semiconductor industry. Familiarity with architectural and FMCS or BMS, Instrumentation engineering principles and practices is essential for effective collaboration with project teams.
Communication and Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. BIM engineers often interact with architects, engineers, contractors, and clients, so excellent communication skills are crucial.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Abilities: The capacity to identify and resolve design conflicts, perform analysis, and provide innovative solutions. Attention to detail, critical thinking, and the ability to work under pressure are valuable traits.
It's important to note that the specific requirements and responsibilities of a BIM engineer may vary based on the organization, project complexity, and regional regulations.

title: (Junior) Civil and Structural Design Engineer
company_info: Established in 2018, VEngineers strides to provide innovative solutions to create new values in all stages of the building lifecycle for all stakeholders of the construction industry. Despite it is at the early establishment, with a core team of experienced and dedicated engineers, VEngineers is already highly valued by its clients for its quality service and value-added solutions. Being the pioneer in the field of structure application of high-performance materials, VEngineers works closely with key industry players to develop both structural and non-structural applications of ultra-high-performance concrete (UHPC) in Singapore. UHPC is a type of concrete with compressive strength exceeding 120MPa. With an unrivalled combination of ductility, strength, durability and aesthetics, UHPC is ideal for lightweight and complex architectural structures. VEngineers has successfully developed various industrial applications for UHPC including pre-fabricated bathroom units, facades and claddings.

title: Planning Engineer
company_info: Gamuda Berhad is a public listed company listed on the main board of Bursa Malaysia. Founded in 1976, it has grown from a construction-based enterprise to become Malaysia’s leading infrastructure developer with core competencies in engineering and construction, property development and infrastructure concessions. As a pioneer turnkey contractor with Built-Operate-Transfer (BOT) capability and expertise, the distinct hallmark of Gamuda’s innovation and excellence is evident in numerous projects across Malaysia, South-East Asia, Far East Asia, Indochina and the Middle East. Having built the world’s first dual-purpose tunnel and multi award-winning Stormwater Management and Road Tunnel (SMART) in Malaysia, Gamuda is fast gearing up for its next phase of growth as part of the MMC-Gamuda Joint Venture, which is the appointed Project Delivery Partner and underground works contractor by the Government for the nation’s largest public infrastructure project – the Klang Valley Mass Rapid Transit (KVMRT). Besides the MRT, some of Gamuda’s signature projects include the Kaohsiung Metropolitan Mass Rapid Transit System (KMRT) in Taiwan, the New Doha International Airport (NDIA) and Dukhan Highway in Qatar, as well as the Electrified Double Track Project (Ipoh to Padang Besar), the Damansara-Puchong Highway (LDP) and SPRINT Expressway in Malaysia. JOIN THE TEAM THAT BUILDS ICONIC PROJECTS. Playing a major role in Malaysia’s biggest infrastructure project, the KVMRT, we are on an aggressive talent development endeavour that will provide you a chance to work with top-notch experts in the industry and gain international exposure in the process.

title: SENIOR STRUCTURAL ENGINEER
company_info: VSL SINGAPORE PTE LTD VSL's experience in post-tensioning and related engineering goes back 50 years. VSL operated through 35 subsidiaries as a world-wide network, including 2 production facilities in Spain and China. With 3,900 employees, including 1,100 engineers and technicians, the group provides technical consultancy and support for the full range of works from project planning (development of preliminary designs, alternative design proposals) to complete final designs, construction engineering and on-site activities. Our main strength is the quality of our highly experienced, multicultural staff. We develop new ways of continuously training our experts where we present our new products, equipment and techniques. We also stimulate knowledge-sharing using various platform where ideas on best practices are exchanged.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Technical Centre Presentation:
VSL Technical Centre is part of VSL Group Civil Work Business Line that handle all major civil projects
Five offices around the world, in Singapore, Bern (Switzerland), Barcelona (Spain), Hong Kong and Sydney (Australia).
Technical Centre Singapore (TCSG) is integrated into VSL Singapore PTE LTD and has 35 Engineers & Draughtsman working in 3 Departments: Structural, Project Technical/Methods and Mechanical.
TCSG involvement happens in all aspects of Major Civil Works Projects (mainly bridges),
From Tender stage with definition of main option and construction methodology
To Execution/Construction stages with definition and design of major Equipment to build bridges and special structures
Job Description:
Reporting to Engineer in Charge for large size projects or being Engineer in Charge for medium or small size projects. Main Tasks by Senior Structural Design Engineer are:
Carry out designs of temporary structures in accordance with indications of Engineer in Charge or Department Manager
Carry out designs based on different international standards (EN, BS, AS, HK, etc.)
Coordination with Methods and/or Mechanical Departments during development of designs
Responsible for assigned projects in regards of quality, time, organization, cost, information (as Engineer in Charge)
Managing of engineering and drafting manpower assigned to her / him with regards to quality, schedule and manhours spent
To check work done by other team members and organize project technical review meetings
To identify variation works and propose timeframe and budget for approval of Department Manager
Understanding the time frame (deadlines), monitor progress and inform on changes
Understanding and mitigation of technical risks associated with the task
Seek advice from senior staff if she / he cannot solve a problem on her / his own
Software:
•Good command on MS Office, especially Excel
•Knowledge of Sofistik is a (big) plus but not mandatory
•Good command on AUTOCAD is a bonus
•Knowledge of modelling/design software

Languages:
English
Experience:
Degree in civil engineering
At least 4 years on permanent or temporary works design
Steel structures design
Repair and strengthening projects will be a plus

title: Resident Engineer
company_info: Jacobs International Consultants Pte Ltd is an engineering consultancy firm. In Singapore, our business spans across Infrastructure (mainly Water and Transportations) and Advanced Facilities (Life Sciences, Biopharma, Pharmaceuticals, Semiconductor, and Data Centre) sectors. Globally we have 55,000 employees, which includes nearly 500 employees in Singapore. What drives you drives us as we work to build a better world together. At Jacobs, every day is an opportunity to make the world better, more connected, more sustainable. We’re powered by people across the globe who deliver innovative scientific, technical, professional and program management solutions for public and private clients around the world. ​We’re always looking for dynamic and engaged people to join our team. Bring your passion, your ingenuity and your vision. Let’s see the impact we can create, together.​
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with the disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, we recognize these challenges, and our engineers, scientists, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges.
Our Water business is hiring a Resident Engineer to be part of a Water Treatment Plant project located in Tuas, Singapore. Main duties:
Working with the Chief Resident Engineer and Lead RE, evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering and construction management and supervision techniques, procedures, and criteria.
Under general supervision of a Project Manager /Construction Manager and Lead RE, carry out general contract administration and management
Manage and supervise Resident Technical Officer(s) (RTO) assigned to the project.
With additional experience within one area, the individual is expected to assist in the design of larger and more complex assignments
Provides leadership and accountability for the implementation, and measurable performance, of the Jacobs Beyond Health and Safety Program.
To be a successful candidate you shall possess:
Degree in Civil Engineering from BCA recognized university
Minimum of 5 years of relevant design and construction experience
RE registration with IES-JAC
Proficient in civil and structural design software and Ms Office Suite
Jacobs. A world where you can.
From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.
With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs. Jacobs complies with the Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices (TGFEP), including the prevailing guidelines on recruitment. All qualified applicants will be considered for the position regardless of age, race, religion, language, nationality, marital status, or family responsibilities.
#ASIAID #ASIAWater

title: REPORT ENGINEER (ASSISTANT CIVIL ENGINEER)
company_info: GEONAMICS (S) PTE LTD A One-Stop professional testing company in Singapore with operations in Malaysia and Myanmar together with our sister companies GEOLAB (M) SDN BHD and GEONAMICS (M) SDN BHD. We are a team of highly qualified and experienced professionals with more than three decades of project experience across various countries, providing a wide range of specialty geotechnical services, from field to lab testing and evaluation. In addition, as one of the most experienced companies for soil investigation in Singapore, we provide both integrated land and marine soil investigation services. We also invest and deploy the latest industry leading, state of the art equipment and machinery to better support your projects challenging requirements.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Report Engineer (Assistant Civil Engineer), you will play a crucial role in providing vital support to the engineering team by preparing progress reports, work done reports, and various engineering documents. Your attention to detail and strong analytical skills will ensure that project updates and information are accurately recorded and communicated. You will also contribute to the company's internal quality management processes and maintain monthly reports, helping to ensure the smooth execution of projects.

Responsibilities:
Prepare timely and accurate progress reports for ongoing projects, highlighting key milestones, achievements, and challenges.
Assist in the preparation of comprehensive work done reports, detailing the completed tasks, materials used, and any deviations from the initial plan.
Support the engineering team in maintaining internal quality management documents, ensuring that project processes adhere to standards.
Update and maintain monthly reports, including project status, and resource allocation, to provide a clear overview of project performance.
Undertake any ad-hoc duties as assigned, contributing to the overall success of the engineering department.
Requirements:
Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Candidate that does not fulfill this minimum requirement but with relevant experience would be considered.
Meticulous and detail-oriented, with the ability to spot errors and discrepancies in reports and documents.
Strong analytical capabilities to interpret project data, identify trends, and make informed recommendations.
Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple reports and tasks efficiently.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, contractors, and clients.
Familiarity with engineering software and tools, including MS Office suite, AutoCAD, or project management software.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Roles & Responsibilities

· Reports to the Director
· Overall responsible for effective project implementation, efficient use of resources till successful projects completion within contractual schedule and budgeted cost
· Leading and mentoring a team by setting guidelines and /or procedures, providing advice and supervision when necessary
· Ensuring all works carried out meet company's quality standards and requirements
· To co-ordinate with the clients, sub-contractors and consultants on all project matters
· To ensure engineers, supervisors & foremen meets client & regulatory requirements
· Prepare Master program
· Certification of payment, site disputes, planning of site facilities and workers quarters (if required)
· Decide on the cost of variation works and time implications
· Identify staff recruitment and training needs
· Evaluate staff performance of the project team
· Toensure Environmental, Safety and Health practices are carried out at all times
· Take reasonably practical measures to eliminate any foreseeable risk to any person who is at work in that workplace
· Confirm and record working hours usage quantity materials of subcontractors, manpower and equipment available on site daily and also working hours of sites
· Review the plan and financial projections for the job to be sure that they are accurate and reasonable

Requirements

· Diploma/Degree in Civil Engineering
· With more than 3 years relevant Civil Engineering experience and Structural Steel in Singapore
· Prior working experience with LTA/HDB projects will be highly advantageous.
· Have good interpersonal, communication and people management skills
· Ability to present a professional image and to act in the best interests of the Company
· Immediate or Short notice preferred

Kindly include the following on your CV/Resume:

· Reason for leaving (All past and present employment)
· Last drawn Salary
· Expected Salary
· Availability and Notice Period
We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

title: Design Engineer
company_info: The COENS Group is an integrated services provider headquartered in Busan, South Korea since 1999. Our over 20 years of experience in managing and executing workforce solutions and other technical services for international projects make us an ideal partner of Clients, placing us as a top integrated services provider in South Korea. Our prowess lies in furnishing tailored project solutions to organizations involved in the delivery of some of the world’s largest and most complex projects with a particular expertise in providing full project teams. With over 16 offices in strategic locations in Asia and beyond, COENS is staffed with industry specialists backed with many years of relevant experience in the provision of recruitment, destination mobility services and project site support to Clients in key industries. COENS has operational offices in over 6 countries worldwide including South Korea, China, Singapore, Myanmar, Russia, and USA. Our depth and presence in these strategic locations stamps our territory to ably yield to client’s needs on a local, regional and global level. With trusted know-how in project support, COENS expanded our field to various sectors by establishing associated offices and entities. COENS Energy Pte Ltd. in Singapore is a licensed Employment Agency. Its industry experienced staff provides manpower services to Clients in various sectors such as Oil and Gas, Chemical, ICT, Civil Infrastructure, Building Construction, and Financial Services. In more recent years, it has provided technical recruitment, contractor management, tailored project solutions, and assignment support services through its highly experienced delivery teams.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Geotechnical Engineer

Working Hours: 8.30am – 6pm
Location: Near Ubi Mrt
Salary: Up to $5800

Job Scope:
Civil & Structural/ Geotechnical design, analysis and assessment for ground improvement works, foundation, excavation, earth retaining structures, slope, instrumentation and site investigation.

Familiar with geotechnical design in Eurocodes.
Well versed in civil & structural/ geotechnical design software such as Plaxis, TEDDS...etc.
Familiar with Authorities submission requirements for civil/ infrastructure engineering projects.
Familiar with ground improvement works, civil ad structural designs and BIM will be in advantage.

title: Senior Tender Engineer
company_info: Founded in 1994 as a small start-up company, HSL has grown rapidly to become a key regional player in the marine civil engineering sector. Abiding relentlessly by our own guiding principles – innovative engineering solutions and construction excellence, we have left a trail of landmark projects across virtually every industry requiring foreshore structures and facilities. Building on our engineering expertise and experience, we have progressively expanded into related areas of business including plant engineering, industrial building construction, ground engineering and third-party inspection services. Today, HSL is actively engaged in a wide spectrum of engineering disciplines, backed by dedicated teams of professionals who can confidently meet construction and maintenance needs, both on land and sea. Marine Civil Engineering Delivering cost effective solutions and meeting all your engineering needs for construction of ports, jetties, wharfs, shipyards, dry docks and cooling water intake stations, and providing maintenance for existing foreshore facilities. Plant Engineering Providing plant-related construction and maintenance services including piling, equipment foundations, pipe rack structures, above-ground storage tank foundations, warehouses, factories, offices, laboratories, and clean room construction. Ground Engineering Solutions Via our subsidiary HSL Ground Engineering, we provide innovative solutions to the most challenging geotechnical problems as construction increasingly takes place on varied and unstable terrains. Our full range of ground engineering services includes bored piling, micropiling, diaphragm walls, soil stabilisation and secant wall.

title: Resident Engineer (Bored Tunnels)
company_info: Binnies is a part of RSK Group, a leading integrated environmental, engineering and technical group of companies comprising of over 100 businesses in 38 countries globally. We help clients across the globe to collect, store, move and treat water and wastewater efficiently and effectively; plan and manage watersheds and harness the energy embedded in the treatment and movement of water. Binnies is proud of our more than 100-year heritage, helping clients across the globe efficiently and effectively collect, store, move and treat water and wastewater; plan and manage watersheds and harness the energy embedded in the treatment and movement of water. We are committed to creating sustainable infrastructure to meet the net-zero challenge and environmental enhancement objectives. Aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals we integrate sustainability into everything we do by utilising low and zero-carbon approaches and products and nature-based solutions. Through leading-edge digital transformation we strive to create more resilient, sustainable, reliable and intelligent solutions. With the use of satellite technology, artificial intelligence and data analytics, our team provides powerful and meaningful insights that lead to better investment decisions. In 2021, Binnies joined the RSK Group and today, we operate across Europe and the Asia Pacific region with offices in the UK, Singapore, Hong Kong, mainland China, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The role is primarily to support the Binnies Singapore office to secure and deliver the Coastal and Flood Risk projects in Singapore. In addition, the successful individual will require to provide support to UK offices to deliver their Flood, Coastal, and Maritime projects.
It is primarily a technical role involving participation in maritime and coastal related civil engineering projects and studies. The individual will require performing design tasks, various studies, engineering management, client liaising, and communicating with other teams and offices.

The individual may need to work as a coastal specialist working closely with the same discipline and other multidisciplinary teams. This is a great opportunity for the successful candidate to develop his/her technical and engineering management skills, particularly in various types of flood, maritime and coastal projects, and obtain international experience.
The key duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Design of coastal and coastal related structures
Undertake various coastal studies
Perform the projects/tasks within the agreed budget and programme
Client liaising
Attending meetings both internal external
Progress monitoring & reporting
Proposal preparation
Required Competencies
CPD in the relevant specialist skill area
BSc or MEng (Hons) Coastal Engineering
Specialist knowledge of areas such as metocean studies, feasibility studies, Beach and shore management plan preparation, and detailed design
Coastal engineering knowledge (tide, current, waves, wave overtopping, rubble mound structures, tidal and storm surge barriers, coast protection works)
Sound knowledge of BS Maritime & Eurocode codes and industry-standard guidelines such as CIRIA and other relevant international standards and guidelines
Performing calculations and desktop studies with limited guidance
Project report writing
Proposal writing
Understands support needed by junior staff
Team player
Adaptable
Experience work in multidisciplinary coastal projects
At least 10 years of experience in planning, design and/or implementation of coastal, marine, reclamatin infrastructure projects
Experience in project management in the planning, design and/or implementation of coastal, marine, reclamation infrastructure projects is a plus point
Experience in client liaising and leading technical meetings
Education & training:
BSc or MEng in Civil and Coastal Engineering
A registered Professional / Chartered Engineer under the Civil / Coastal Engineering Discipline is a plus point
Background & experience:
Post-graduation consultancy office experience
Knowledge base:
Coastal engineering design & studies
Knowledge of Eurocodes/BS 6349/CIRIA Guidelines
Skills:
Site assessments
Design of coastal structures
Metocean studies and surveys
Feasibility studies
Good experience in using design software
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Client liaising
Excellent interpersonal skills
Personal attributes:
Proven ability to carry out design and other tasks reliably
Always seeking improvement in design and delivery performance
Recognises client needs and delivers solutions
Self-motivated
Willing to make international travel for both short and long terms assignments with a short notice.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client operates the world’s largest crane vessels and with them, they transport, install, and remove offshore structures for the offshore energy markets. Their projects range from installing wind turbines, removing retired offshore oil and gas platforms, and installing platforms up to 50,000 metric tons.

Job Description
Provide technical work preparation services for product development, study, tender, and commercial T&I projects.
To go offshore on vessels and see your designs and work in action, supporting the fleet with anything that requires a bright technical mind and pro-active attitude.
Develop execution methods for offshore projects, selection of required equipment, concept and detail design of lifting arrangements, etc.
Perform engineering, technical project preparation, and execution support of offshore projects, i.e. heavy lift installation projects.
Review and organize a review of internal and external deliverables (drawings, reports, and procedures).
Prepare and coordinate subcontractor Scope of Works.
Requirements:
A Bachelor's and/or Masters degree in Offshore Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar.
A minimum of 2 years or 5 years (senior) of experience in engineering, project preparation, and execution of offshore projects.
A good understanding of the Company's assets and equipment capabilities in order to win, prepare, and execute offshore projects.
Excellent analytical, practical, and pragmatic skills.
Good communication skills in English, both spoken and written.
Supervisory and coaching skills to provide guidance to less experienced engineers.
The ambition is to work (temporarily) offshore on our vessels, overseas, or in our other offices.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description of Project Engineer:
We are looking for an experienced project manager to join our civil engineering team. As a project manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and guiding projects from start to finish. Your knowledge and expertise will be invaluable in ensuring that projects are delivered on-time and within budget. You will be working with a highly skilled team of professionals who are dedicated to providing top-quality work and are committed to customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
• Develop project plans, goals, and budgets.
• Identify and secure resources needed to complete the project.
• Coordinate with all stakeholders to ensure project requirements are met.
• Manage risk and change to ensure successful project delivery.
• Monitor project progress regularly and adjust plans as necessary.
• Communicate project status and updates to all stakeholders.
• Ensure the project is delivered on-time and within budget.
• Foster a positive team environment and work collaboratively with all team members.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or a related field.
• Proven track record of successful project delivery in the civil engineering industry.
• Strong leadership and communication skills.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Good understanding of project management software and techniques.
• Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
· To coordinate with design consultants for structural submissions to relevant Authorities.
· To coordinate with construction team and follow up with consultants for timely submissions.
· To manage progress of structural design submissions by consultants.
· To review structural submission drawings and design reports prepared by consultants in terms of feasibility for construction.
· To review the shop drawings (mainly RC structure, occasionally temporary steel structure) prepared by subcontractors before submitting to consultants for final approval.
· To prepare in-house design/shop drawings for RC structure by instructing and managing project cad-drafter.
· To carry out independent design check on the proposal submitted by consultants and work on the possibilities to optimize the structural members for ease of construction.
· To carry out feasibility studies to compare various design options possible and choose the most cost effective and efficient method to proceed with construction works.
· Other duties as required.
Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in civil engineering or relevant.
· Minimum 3-5 years’ relevant working experience.
· Should have experience and capability of shop drawing management for underground RC structure.
· Site experience (as design team) in LTA project is preferred.
· Possess design management with consultant on structural engineering.
· Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines and requires minimum supervision.
· Positive attitude and good discipline and good team player.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Project/Site Engineer

Reporting to the Construction Manager, the Project/Site Engineer has the following responsibilities:

1. To assist the Construction Manager in project planning, programming and monitoring of works on site.
2. To assist the Construction Manager in managing and implementing the quality, environmental, health, and safety (QEHS)management systems of PIKASA on site.
3. To monitor and coordinate with the Clerk-of-works for inspections of the works.
4. To analyze customer complaints and provide remedial actions.
5. To follow up on non-complying works and materials for corrective and preventive actions from sub-contractors and suppliers.
6. To assist the Construction Manager to ensure compliance with the management system procedures.
7. To participate in Project Review Meeting.
8. To assist the Construction Manager in the preparation of the Master Construction Programme.
9. To assist the Construction Manager in monitoring progress of works and update the Master Construction Programme.
10. To assist the Construction Manager in preparation of monthly progress reports.
11. Supervision in constructing on site works.
12. Any other duties as assigned by Top Management

Candidate must possess Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering.

title: Civil Engineer

Leveraging on our insight of the Asia talent landscape, we will connect you to Asia’s best talent resources and be your No. 1 recruitment partner in Asia. E.A License: 15C7687
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a design and build construction service provider with an in-housemulti-disciplinary design consultancy capability led by a dedicated team of professionals to undertake building, civil engineering, and infrastructure projects. They are currently hiring for Civil Engineer and will like to invite suitable candidates to send detailed resume to talent@asiasearch.com.sg

Civil Engineer

Responsibilities
Assist the Project Manager in the management of Health, Safety & Security hazards/risks and Environmental aspects/impacts throughout the project
Ensure the construction works are done according to drawings and within the specified standards
Oversee the day to day running of all matters relating to the construction of this project, particularly on civil & structural and architectural works
Resolve discrepancies or problems relating to HSSE and quality of work together with Project Management Team and report all progress of work safety and incidents promptly
Review and discuss construction method and choice of material with Project Manager, Consultants and specialist works-contractors and finalize the most appropriate practical, productive and safety construction method in advance of works for compliance to statutory requirements
Ensure all Consultant/Client instructions and correspondences related to HSSE and quality are properly documented and disseminated to his/her subordinates and sub-contractors
Ensure that the monthly productivity data are submitted to Quality Assurance, Eco-Productivity Department. for review and consolidation
As practicable as possible, he/she shall work with his Project Management Team and subcontractors to implement Green & Gracious practices and ensure all site materials and wastages, consumption and cost are reduced and minimized in the course of all works
Adhere to all relevant legal requirements in his/her performance of work duties in the project
Comply and adhere with the HSSEQ Management System and implement all relevant requirements stated in the HSSEQ management system
Liaise closely with the project’s HSSE personnel on the required HSSE requirements prior to commencement of all works under his/her charge in the project
Inform the project’s HSSE personnel and all other relevant project personnel of the operational requirements of the scope of works to be performed under his/her charge
Inform the project’s HSSE personnel and all other relevant personnel on the changes to the work operations, work methods, location of work, and change in use of machinery or equipment, change in competent persons to perform the work, etc. so that the appropriate HSSE controls can be implemented to mitigate the risks/impacts arising from such changes
Ensure all internal and external work parties under his/her charge perform their work in accordance to relevant legal requirements
Organize the project site and other places of work so that all operations are carried out to the required HSSEQ standards, with minimum of HSSE risks and impacts to men, equipment, materials, environment, etc
Ensure that HSSE requirements receive the highest priority in all work and that compliance with WSH regulations is maintained at all times
Undertake the appointment as member of the project’s Risk Management Team
Undertake the appointment as member of the project’s HSSE Committee
Ensure all personnel performing work in the project is adequately trained
Ensure that the method and sequence of construction operation is in accordance with the approved method statement
Ensure all internal and external parties under his/her charge is trained in the HSSERIAs and SWPs as well as any other relevant HSSE documentation before they are allowed commencement work in the project
Ensure that suitable and effective personal protective equipment and safety equipment are issued to the workmen for their scope of works
Ensure all machinery, plant and equipment, hand tools, etc. used by the workmen under his/her charge are maintained in good safe working condition and that all guards and other appropriate safety devices are properly fitted and functioning
Ensure all machinery, plant and equipment, hand tools, etc. are positioned effectively without endangering men and equipment
Ensure that all registers, records and reports are maintained in order, and the competent persons appointed to carry out work in the project has sufficient knowledge of plant, machinery, equipment and tool to evaluate all aspects of its safe operation
Enforce and ensure that good housekeeping conditions are maintained at all work areas
Conduct regular joint HSSE inspections with the project’s HSSE personnel to identify and rectify HSSE non-conformities/non-compliances discovered in the project
Ensure all HSSEQ non-conformities/non-compliances reported to him/her by any party are rectified with the provision of effective corrective measures
He/she is authorized to cease and unsafe work activity immediately to prevent occurrence of incident and/or serious HSSE non-conformity/non-compliance
Requirements
Degree in Civil Engineering or its equivalent
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in the construction industry
Only Singaporean

title: C&S Engineer (Civil / Infrastructure projects)
company_info: Meinhardt Group is one of the world’s largest integrated engineering company which provides engineering capabilities in Infrastructure and Environment; Structures; Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing (MEP); Project Management; and Planning and Urban Development. Our specialist capabilities cover Façade Engineering; Environmentally Sustainable Design (ESD); Specialist and Architectural Lighting; Fire Performance Engineering; Integrated Design Management; and Mission Critical Facility Design. Headquartered in Singapore, we currently employ over 3500 staff located in 38 permanent offices across Australia, Asia, Middle East, North Africa, UK and Europe.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

This role is involved in all project stages from study, planning, designing, tendering, construction inspection, to commissioning for civil and infrastructure engineering projects like drainage, pumping station, pipelines, sewer, etc.
Prepare detailed civil and environmental design documentation and drawings, perform design calculations
Perform analysis and studies for projects assigned
Review and ensure projects comply with relevant statutory standards and codes and client requirements
Prepare tender specification, documentation and other relevant materials for bidding
Communicate proactively with clients, contractors and other parties involved
Supervise junior engineers and drafters
Identify and resolve technical / site problems
Attend design, clients, architects and site meetings
Job Requirement
Degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent
At least 2 years of experience in civil projects, preferably in an engineering consultancy environment.
Strong technical background in the concept and design of civil works involving structural, infrastructure
Possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Able to work independently as well as in a team to meet tight project timeline

Job Description & Requirements

title: Internal Audit Senior Executive / Associate – Construction Audits (Quantity Survey or / Civil Engineering)
company_info: E M SERVICES PRIVATE LIMITED Since our inception in 1988, E M Services Pte Ltd (E M Services) has been committed to deliver the highest standard of property management services. Founded as a joint venture between the Housing and Development Board and Keppel Land Limited, E M Services is now a leader in the field of property management services. Our premier range of services comprises property, engineering, contracts and project management in public housing, commercial and private properties.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Analyse information required for the planning of each audit assignment.
Assist in the design of audit program (including audit procedures and audit tests) of each audit assignment.
Based on the approved audit program, perform internal audit work (including follow-up of past audit issues) and gather evidence in accordance with the internal audit standards.
Audit work include evaluation of technical appraisals of the project and cost estimates, site check to ascertain that work done on site comply with drawings and specifications, verification of accurate payment for work done based on measurement of quantity and correct rates being applied.
Evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of business processes (including internal controls and risk management), and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and Company’s policies and procedures for construction-related operations.
Document accurate audit work performed and audit result in a clear and organised manner, supported by audit evidence (such as comprehensive site photo) for review by Team leader. Resolve review notes and apply learning to future assignments.
Identify, develop and draft comprehensive audit observations (including root causes and risks) on weaknesses in control environment, and make value-added recommendations for process improvements.
At the end of fieldwork review, assists Team Leader in conducting closing meetings to communicate draft audit findings to management.
Assist Team Leader in finalizing the report and collate management responses to audit findings and action plans to mitigate risk.
Track issues identified by Internal Audit and external auditors, and monitor implementation progress of management action plans. Conduct validation review on management remediation actions to address control deficiencies.
Assist in developing Annual Internal Audit Plan using a risk-based approach.
Assist in the preparation of deliverables such as audit reports and presentation materials to Management and Audit Committee
Ensure assigned projects are completed in a timely manner and within the project budget allocated.
Use of data analytics techniques in audit assignments.
Perform ad hoc tasks and special projects/reviews as assigned.
Job Requirements
A good Diploma/Degree in Structural & Civil Engineering/Building/Quantity Surveying/Estate Management/Construction Management or equivalent from a recognised polytechnic/university or relevant professional qualification.
Relevant experience of at least 3 years in construction management with exposure in handling projects covering work relating to technical appraisals, cost estimates, site checks and quantity measurement.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (i.e. Word, Excel and Powerpoint). Knowledge in data analytics tools will be an advantage.
Good organisational and interpersonal skills with ability to interact effectively with multi-disciplinary colleagues at all levels
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with high attention to details.
Ability to exercise objective judgement with strong logical and critical thinking skills.
Self-motivated team player with continuous learning attitude, sharing knowledge and ideas within Internal Audit.
Positive work attitude, with high level of commitment and initiative.
Good verbal and written business communications with strong report writing and presentation skills
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Proactive and adaptable to changing priorities and different challenges
Ability to maintain and ensure confidentiality
Maintain high level of integrity and professional standards

company_info: Hyundai Engineering & Construction (Hyundai E&C) is the first Korean construction company to venture successfully through overseas expansion to Southeast Asia and Middle East. We are building a better world with creative ideas and passion and a better future through constant innovation and challenges. Being a global EPCM company, we will break away from the traditional construction-oriented business structure to offer total engineering solutions encompassing designing, engineering, and operations. By venturing into new markets overseas, and establishing an optimized management infrastructure, we will pursue the diversification of overseas projects and become a global EPCM company that leads the construction business worldwide. Hyundai E&C aim to create unrivaled value by fostering talents who strive to be the best in uncharted territories. We also target to cultivate a people-centered corporate culture where the top priority is placed on our employees and customers. We establishes a free and horizontal culture that breaks away from the conventional corporate culture of rigid bureaucracy. By creating an open and diverse culture, all our members are carefully listen to and empathize with each other. We prioritize ‘people’ above all and create a better life, ultimately working to build a future in which all stakeholders can prosper and grow together. Together, We Build Tomorrow

title: Engineering Intern (BIM)
company_info: NatSteel traces its lineage to 1961, when it was incorporated as National Iron and Steel Mills. A pioneer and key partner in Singapore’s nation building efforts, our products are used in most construction projects island-wide, from the iconic Changi International Airport to the public housing that is the trademark of Singapore’s landscape. Singapore is home to NatSteel’s headquarters as well as its flagship plant, which boasts one of the largest single downstream rebar fabrication operations in the world. The Singapore plant is the only local steel mill with an integrated upstream and downstream operation, where steel is manufactured through recycling scrap, and fabricated according to customers’ needs.
description:

Programme Title
To design and prepare accurate and effective detailing, scheduling details from structural drawing, produce BIM and autocad placement drawing to facilitate the fabrication of products

Job Description
Preparing accurate reinforcement detailing schedules for structural product in construction industry in terms of reinforcement quantity, bar size and shape, prepare shop drawings for easy interpretation and understanding.
Attending site meetings for any projects to know of their requirements and provide building solution for feasible product to use, study the construction drawings, productive to use for production
Improving on detailing method to develop internal production capabilities using BIM or autocad for shop drawings for products, e.g. Slab, beam, column and wall, ensuring technical shop drawing schedule provided meet the quality standard

Requirements
Study majoring in Civil Engineering

title: Project Engineer
company_info: WEE HUR CONSTRUCTION PTE LTD
address: WEE HUR BUILDING, 39 KIM KEAT ROAD 328814
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
Job Description

a) To report to the Manager or team leader as shown in the organization chart. He/she is responsible for the assigned or related project tasks and responsibilities.

b) The detailed duties and responsibilities include but not limited to the following:

i) Study and fully understand the ISO requirements, technical drawings, scope, contractual requirements and sub-contract agreements. Work with the consultants to resolve technical issues prior to construction.

ii) Submit to superior for feedback and concurrence on short or medium-term programmes and execute the works according to the detailed programme.

iii) Ensure that the works are carried out according to the approved drawings, quality procedures and EHS requirements. Managing the works with excellent housekeeping is a key focus.

iv) For quality management, the engineer is responsible to fully implement with the quality recordings, carry out result analysis and formulate action plans for continuous improvement.

v) Implement and maintain proper recordings to comply with EHS, quality, client and authorities’ requirements.

vi) Responsible for cost management so that the materials used for both temporary works and permanent works are not damaged or control the wastage within specified tolerance. Rework or abortive work which has serious time and cost impacts shall be avoided.

vii) Ad-hoc matters as assigned by the PM which is necessary for the execution of the project.

Job Requirement
- Degree in Civil Engineering/ M&E Engineering
- Mininum 2 - 5 years' experience working in construction industry
