title: Senior Engineer (Installation)
company: HEEREMA MARINE CONTRACTORS SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
company_info: HEEREMA MARINE CONTRACTORS SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Do you want to work for a leading marine contractor in technically challenging offshore projects from our Singapore Office?

At Heerema Marine Contractors, we do something new every day. We operate the world’s largest crane vessels and with them we transport, install and remove offshore structures for the offshore energy markets. Our projects range from installing wind turbines, removing retired offshore oil and gas platforms, and installing platforms up to 50,000 metric tons. By joining us, you will play an important part in our unique maritime adventure.

As a Senior Installation Engineer you provide technical work preparation services for product development, study, tender and commercial T&I projects.

You will have the opportunity to go offshore on our vessels and see your designs and work in action, supporting our fleet with anything that requires a bright technical mind and pro-active attitude.

Daily activities
Your tasks and responsibilities include the following:
Develop execution methods for offshore projects, selection of required equipment, concept and detail design of lifting arrangements etc.
Perform engineering, technical project preparation and execution support of offshore projects, i.e. heavy lift installation projects.
Review and organize review of internal and external deliverables (drawings, reports and procedures).
Prepare and coordinate subcontractor Scope of Works.

Who will you work with?
The Senior Installation Engineer is member of the Technology Department. You will work in a team with other engineers in various disciplines and actively liaise with colleagues in other departments, like procurement, fabrication, operations, logistics etc.

Is this the job for you?
You are a team player who organizes and plans the work and the involvement of others effectively and efficiently. You are quality and result oriented and have the ability to adapt easily when needed. Next to this you take the different interests of different divisions of the organization and mutual relations into account. You recognize the effects and results of your own decisions or activities on other parts of the organization.

Furthermore, you have:
A Bachelor and/or Masters degree in Offshore Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Similar.
A minimum of 2 years or 5 years of experience in engineering, project preparation and execution of offshore projects.
A good understanding of Heerema Marine Contractors assets and equipment capabilities in order to win, prepare and execute offshore projects.
Excellent analytical, practical and pragmatic skills.
Good communication skills in English, both spoken and written.
Supervisory and coaching skills to provide guidance to less experienced engineers.
The ambition to work (temporarily) offshore on our vessels, overseas or in our other offices.

title: Senior Transport Engineer
company_info: Established in Singapore since 1968, Arup is a global design, engineering and business consultancy with more than 14,000 staff spanning 92 offices in 40 countries. We pursue quality and excellence which is reflected in our portfolio of award-winning projects including Marina Bay Sands, Sydney Opera House and the Singapore Sports Hub. We summarise our mission in one statement: We Shape A Better World. This encapsulates our team-working, creativity, sustainability principles and global nature: as well as recognising the significant role we, with our clients and collaborators, play in leaving a legacy for future generations to come.
job_category: Building and Construction, Consulting, Design, Engineering
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Do you want to make a positive impact on the world? Sustainable development is at the heart of everything we do.

Seventy-five years ago, we created a home for creative thinkers seeking to solve the world’s biggest challenges. Today, a collective of 16,000+ Arupians gather across the globe from 140 different countries to build a sustainable future.

We strive to create an inclusive environment and give everyone a voice. Diversity drives innovation in our projects and offers empathy to the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage applications from people living with disability and provide workplace adjustments.

At Arup, you’ll do more than work — you’ll shape a better world.

About this role
With an emerging portfolio in urban mobility, Arup requires a motivated individual with proven Transport Planning skills. The purpose of this role is to support the planning offering in Arup’s Singapore office. This is a high impact role that comprises client engagement, work winning, project delivery, discipline leadership and technical advice. .


What will I do?
You will work within transport planning and traffic engineering project teams to support project and bid delivery through undertaking traffic engineering analysis, designs, and solutions for development and infrastructure projects
To be responsible for the performance and development of others through providing guidance, training, direction and feedback.
Utilises prior experience in conducting analysis of problems, consults others, and helps to develop solutions to bring a focus to technical excellence, strong writing, communication and analysis skills, and an enthusiasm for developing human-centred and sustainable transport outcomes
To work without supervision, referring up as necessary, and be responsible for meeting deadlines, monitoring budgets and controlling expenditure to meet financial targets in your own area.
Monitors and manages budgets: identifies actions to meet agreed financial targets.

What will I bring?
Recognised relevant tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering, preferably with Transport modules, or similar areas;
Minimum 7 years of relevant industry experience in the field of transport planning / traffic engineering, within a consulting business environment;
Experience in traffic planning and design in all stages of road design, from concept to reinstatement. Knowledge of Singapore regulations and approvals process.
Strong knowledge in transport planning / traffic engineering including complex traffic management, construction planning, and transport impact assessments, and software such as SIDRA Intersection, VISSIM, and similar modelling packages
Proficient in Bentley OpenRoads, MicroStation, and AutoCAD.

Our firm
Arup is an independent firm of designers, planners, engineers, architects, consultants, and technical specialists, working across every aspect of the built environment.

Founded by Sir Ove Arup, a gifted engineer-philosopher with an original and restless mind, our firm has always had a keen sense of purpose.

We create spaces where everyone feels safe, seen and included and able to perform at their best. We take an approach to flexible working that supports the diversity and well-being of our members.

Are you ready to shape a better world?
Our open roles are waiting for you on the Arup careers page. If you like what you see here, apply today.

Arup does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Engineer cum PE Assignee
company_info: Bachy Soletanche Singapore Pte Ltd has been providing innovative geotechnical and foundation engineering solutions in Singapore since the mid 1970s. As a leader in the industry our expertise successfully delivers technically challenging projects. An uncompromising commitment at a corporate level to prioritise safety performance has resulted in award-winning initiatives developed by Bachy Soletanche Singapore. During the 1970s, Bachy Soletanche contributed to developing water infrastructure projects in Singapore. The company was incorporated in 1982, and has been involved in the development and construction of Singapore’s Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) from its earliest phases to date. The company diversified into geotechnical and foundation works for the private sector on major projects such as SUNTEC and Bugis Junction while continuing to participate in public sector construction projects such as Central Ministries Building and the New Supreme Court. All the while, Bachy Soletanche has continued to innovate with the introduction of specialist equipment, such as the Hydrofraise, and award winning designs, such as the retaining walls for The Sail@Marina Bay. Bachy Soletanche Singapore is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Soletanche Bachy group of companies, the world’s largest geotechnical engineering group employing over 9,000 permanent staff comprising 60 nationalities. Drawing on the group’s network of more than 1,000 engineers and managers and projects executed in over 100 countries, Bachy Soletanche Singapore provides clients with the full range of the techniques and services of an internationally renowned specialist. Singapore is the regional office for the group’s activities in the Asia Pacific Region.

company_info: WOH HUP (PRIVATE) LIMITED Established in 1927, Woh Hup began humbly as a one-man business in Malaya. Today, we are Singapore’s largest privately owned construction and civil engineering specialist, with a dedicated 1,000-strong workforce, and a body of work spanning many of Singapore’s most notable and iconic developments. At the heart of our four-generation family-run business lies a proud heritage of industry, integrity and enterprise, focused on creating lasting value for our clients, improving quality and safety standards on every project, and maximising opportunities for our employees to achieve their career potential. These values have fueled the company’s growth consistently for more than 80 years, and continue to do so. In our efforts to continuously raise the industry bar, we seek to introduce innovative new building solutions and broaden our skills through strategic joint-venture partnerships with overseas counterparts. This has seen us emerge in recent years from being a principal player in the building of private residential and commercial developments, to becoming a leader too in large-scale civil engineering works, cementing our position at the forefront of the construction industry, locally and regionally.

title: Design Geotechnical Engineer
company_info: Marine, Civil Engineering & Construction Company
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Soil Investigation Specification & BOQ preparation, Vendor, or agency finalization.
Monitor Soil Investigation to get correct geotechnical design inputs for design.
Foundation recommendation report preparation including back up calculation (In all types of soils & rock)
Pile capacity calculations in various soils/rock. Test pile location plan/ Pile reinforcement calculations & drawing preparation. Validation of pile capacity by Pile load test (Vertical / Lateral / Pull out).
Piled Raft design using latest design tools and theories.
Design using PLAXIS 2D Software (Sheet pile with strutcture waler /Diaphragm wall-struture/contiguous pile with soil/rock anchor)
Design of all components like Anchor capacity, water & structure design, modelling top-down method of construction.
Dewatering system design. (Well point, Drawdown calculations, Open dewatering).
Seepage control techniques like Jet -Grouting, slurry wall & flow net calculations.
Soil improvement using stone column
Design of stone columns, settlement calculations & Liquefaction calculations.
Swelling soil management techniques.
Back Fill material specifications & various compaction techniques used for different back fill materials.
Slope stability calculations and analysis
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree/Diploma in Civil Engineering
Min 5 years of relevant design experience in Geotechnical design
Hands on experience using the analysis & design tools like PLAXIS 2D/3D, SLOPE/W, A-PILE & L-PILE is required.

title: Senior Site Engineer (Building)
company_info: WOH HUP (PRIVATE) LIMITED Established in 1927, Woh Hup began humbly as a one-man business in Malaya. Today, we are Singapore’s largest privately owned construction and civil engineering specialist, with a dedicated 1,000-strong workforce, and a body of work spanning many of Singapore’s most notable and iconic developments. At the heart of our four-generation family-run business lies a proud heritage of industry, integrity and enterprise, focused on creating lasting value for our clients, improving quality and safety standards on every project, and maximising opportunities for our employees to achieve their career potential. These values have fueled the company’s growth consistently for more than 80 years, and continue to do so. In our efforts to continuously raise the industry bar, we seek to introduce innovative new building solutions and broaden our skills through strategic joint-venture partnerships with overseas counterparts. This has seen us emerge in recent years from being a principal player in the building of private residential and commercial developments, to becoming a leader too in large-scale civil engineering works, cementing our position at the forefront of the construction industry, locally and regionally.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Site Engineer (Building) is responsible for assisting the Project Manager on the progress of site works and manpower related aspects of the project.
A summary of the responsibilities of this position are, and not limited to, as follows:
Monitor and review master construction program and preparation of catch-up program, if applicable.
Monitor and supervise Engineers / foremen, ensure compliance to the quality procedures & standard of workmanship. Checking on quality and quantity of work by subcontractors.
Preparation of detailed program for the site team to follow accordingly & completed in time.
Resolve drawing discrepancies & technical difficulties with Technical team.
Preparation of detailed method statements and work instructions for construction.
Coordinates between sub-contractors / vendors / internal departments and monitor site manpower / material / equipment demands to meet schedules.
Liaise with the Consultants on the submission related to structural works and Technical Department.
Plan all works on site, including program schedules and construction methods, forecast equipment, material and manpower requirement, and control usage and wastages of all.
Adherence to safety practices in the workplace.
Value Add of Position
Ability to identify potential and occurring problems that affect the schedule of works at site and recommend solutions to relevant team/department.
Ensuring that the site works are completed with high quality standards and adhering to safety requirements throughout the project.
Qualifications and Education Requirements
Education: Degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized University
Experience: Prior 6-8 years of experience in Singapore Building projects are an advantage
Minimally have completed 1 cycle of the project of at least $100M in project value
Technical Competencies
Technical expertise and knowledge in Foundation, Structural and Civil works
Proficient in Microsoft Project
Good knowledge on method statements

title: Assistant Professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering (20497)
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering in the College of Design and Engineering at National University of Singapore (NUS) invites applications for a tenure-track assistant professor position in hydrology, hydro-meteorology and hydrodynamics. The focus of the position is developing deep understanding of various aspects of hydro-meteorological processes, including but not limited to meso scale convective storms, urban hydrology, effects of urbanisation on hydrological processes, and climate change.

We seek candidates who can contribute to research cluster in coastal protection and mitigation with consideration of climate changes in addition to teaching both undergraduate and postgraduate courses.
Job Requirements
Applicants should have a Ph.D. degree in hydrodynamics and coastal engineering or a relevant discipline. We seek individuals who have, or have the potential to develop a strong record of scholarship, leadership, curricular innovation and excellent funding record. Applicants should demonstrate their competence in research, teaching and industrial applications.

Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Formal application:
Please submit your application, indicating your current/expected salary, supported by a CV and full contacts of 3 referees.

title: Research Fellow (Civil Engineering)
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A Research Fellow position is available in the School of School of Civil and Environmental Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. We are seeking a highly self-motivated individual to work as a Research Fellow, focusing on structural health monitoring and AI technologies for intelligent underground infrastructure modeling and monitoring.

Job Description:
To design and implement fibre optic sensing system and vision system in the underground tunnels to ensure accurate and reliable capture of sensing data and vehicle loads
To install and calibrate fibre sensors on railway tracks and vision sensors in tunnels
To conduct real-time and continuous monitoring
To evaluate performance of rail tracks during operation
To develop efficient machine learning algorithms for fault diagnosis and prognosis
To write project reports and scientific research papers for publication
To make presentations and document project information

Job Requirements:
PhD degree in Civil Engineering or related field
Knowledge of fiber optic sensors and vision sensors
Expertise in sensing, data acquisition and interpretation
Publication track record is an advantage
Proficiency in English

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Site coordination with subcontractors, supervisors and clients.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by superior(s).
Job Requirements
Degree in Civil & Structural Engineering (Certificates must be recognized by PE Board).
Possess skills, knowledge and ability to supervise and manage project effectively
Independent, resulted-oriented and self-driven team player with good communication skills
Class 3 driving license will be added advantage.

Asst Project Manager/Project Manager ($5.5K-$7.5K)
Reporting to senior management, you will have overall responsibility for the effective implementation and successful completion of construction projects undertaken by the Group within schedule, cost and quality.
You will liaise closely with subcontractors, architects, consultants and authorities.
Set guidelines and provide expertise and supervision to the team.
You will effectively manage each phase of the project from design to completion and ensure efficient use of resources and enhance cost-effectiveness.
Requirements
Candidates must possess a Degree in Civil Engineering with at least 5 years relevant working experience in a managerial position.
Other pre-requisites are excellent team spirit, strong technical competence, good interpersonal skills and with a "can-do" attitude.

Planning Engineer (Civil/Interior/Building) Responsibilities
· Developing and preparing Tender Plans, Pre-construction programs / Labor Histograms .
· Develop Baseline Program including EPS, OBS, WBS, Phasing / Zoning Strategy Plan and Key Dates/ Milestones, of the project assuring that the Program is fulfilling all the contractual requirements.
· Detailed Planning & scheduling for various stages of the projects that involved works related to various disciplines such as Contracts, Engineering ,Procurement and Construction
· Assigning Recourses to the project, monitoring the resources allocation and taking actions if there are any conflicts or peaks.
· Developing Cost Breakdown Structure and produce the project cash flow, making sure that the project is always within the budget / Cost control.
· Proactively monitoring the overall Work progress & Contractors Performance.
· Review the progress status reports of all the contractors on board.
· Prepare and issue monthly reports of project progress.
· Update & Monitor the overall Baseline Schedule & Key Dates.
· Preparation and updating of S-Curves, Resources Histogram and monthly Cash Flow.
· Managing the program’s Resources Histograms, monitoring the progress against Planned Figures and realized benefits as the program progresses.
· Responsible for supporting the Senior Project Manager, highlighting the areas of concerns, Issues or order to take corrective actions and implementing the preventive actions in order to avoid similar issues in the future.
· Review of major scope changes, ensuring that any impact on time is assessed.
· Responsible for assessing time extension requests and provide recommendations against the same.
· Travel to the site offices for visiting the projects / updating the progress when its needed
· Preparation of Time Impact Analysis
· Recognised qualification in Building Services Engineering or other appropriate engineering subject is preferred. Candidates without formal engineering qualifications may be considered if they have acquired sufficient experience (minimum 4 years in the role of a relevant construction management position) to demonstrate competence in the skills necessary to fulfil the role.
· Membership of professional body preferred
· Computer literate – Prima Vera/Microsoft Office
· 4 years of industry relevant experience

Project Coordinator
To manage projects by supervising and coordinating the site activities
Monitoring of work progress, attending project meetings, liaising with clients and consultants
Assist Project Manager in carrying out all shop drawings, method statements submission
Ensures the timely preparation of project progress reports, inspection records, handover records, defects list etc.
Record all defects of works, ensure proper documentation for all variation orders and others
Ability to complete and hand over projects within tight timeline and quality expectation
To make pro-active response on site problems and resolved immediately with the Project team
To ensure all aspect of QA and QC matters
Observe proper construction safety measures and ensure safety compliance at site
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma Holder or other relevant qualifications
Min 3 years of relevant working experience in interior fit-out works or construction field is required
Able to work independently and under tight schedule
Good project coordination and management skill
Able to read architectural & technical drawings thus translates to construction activities
Good working knowledge of MS Office and Outlook

title: EXECUTIVE / PROJECT ENGINEER, TRACKWORK
company_info: LTA is a statutory board under the Ministry of Transport that spearheads land transport developments in Singapore. Our objective is to deliver a land transport network that is integrated, efficient, cost-effective and sustainable to meet the nation's needs. We manage the construction of new Rapid Transit System (RTS) projects, as well as upgrading of existing rail lines. Besides RTS projects, we also enhance the road network and provide motorist with a greater choice of travel routes by carrying out projects to widen, upgrade and build new roads. In addition, we manage and maintain road structures and facilities so that they are operational at all times. Besides land transport infrastructural development, LTA also covers regulatory and maintenance functions and you can look forward to a good range of exposure and opportunities within LTA.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will play a lead role in managing the Contractors in the construction of new MRT Lines and / or enhancement to Existing Lines. You will be responsible for the safety, quality, progress and environment impact of the Contractors’ works. You will also assist in planning and managing the risks and cashflows of the various contracts as well as the issuance of instructions and assessment of variations/payments/claims. During the course of work, you are expected to liaise with various parties, such as project teams, contractors, designers, architects, stakeholders to ensure the projects are well coordinated. You will also liaise with the appointed Railway Operator to review and address their feedback appropriately. You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the construction of the track including the planning and schedule of locomotives at depot and mainline.

• Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering, familiarity with the relevant local codes and transit construction
• Preferably minimum 4 years’ experience in large-scale infrastructure projects
• A good appreciation of the constraints and interface requirements of civil and trackwork
• Strong project management and leadership skills with proven track records
• Good communication (both oral and written) as well as presentation skills
• Team player who is analytical, resourceful, and result-oriented
• Experience in the construction of Civil Defence shelters and underground MRT stations will be an advantage
• Candidate with strong relevant years of experience will be considered for senior positions
• Those without experience are welcome to apply

title: Civil Engineer - Water and Resources
company_info: Established in Singapore since 1968, Arup is a global design, engineering and business consultancy with more than 14,000 staff spanning 92 offices in 40 countries. We pursue quality and excellence which is reflected in our portfolio of award-winning projects including Marina Bay Sands, Sydney Opera House and the Singapore Sports Hub. We summarise our mission in one statement: We Shape A Better World. This encapsulates our team-working, creativity, sustainability principles and global nature: as well as recognising the significant role we, with our clients and collaborators, play in leaving a legacy for future generations to come.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Do you want to make a positive impact on the world? Sustainable development is at the heart of everything we do.
Seventy-five years ago, we created a home for creative thinkers seeking to solve the world’s biggest challenges. Today, a collective of 16,000+ Arupians gather across the globe from 140 different countries to build a sustainable future.
We strive to create an inclusive environment and give everyone a voice. Diversity drives innovation in our projects and offers empathy to the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage applications from people living with disability and provide workplace adjustments.
At Arup, you’ll do more than work — you’ll shape a better world.
About this role
As a world leader in its field, Arup offers the full spectrum of civil engineering consulting services. As part of the Civil Water and Resources team, this role covers a broad range of skills relating to civil infrastructure. In particular, the focus of the Civil Engineer is to undertake design and consulting services within the Civil Engineering discipline in order to enhance the team’s portfolio of skills and expertise.
What will I do?
Provide design across project lifecycle from Master Plan and Feasibility Stages through Concept, Preliminary and Detailed Design and provide support to projects in construction.
Technical inputs that include areas such as earthworks, designing roads, drainage, water, sewer, WSUD, utilities, paving and minor civil structures and geotechnical elements.
Involved in small and medium sized projects, as well as being a key member of larger project groups. This will include design, technical documentation, input to cost estimates, tender submissions, project scheduling and meeting deadlines and budgets. You will work on a variety of Energy, Water, Land Development, Aviation, Rail and Industrial projects.
Represent Arup at internal and external events, meetings and workshops and you may be responsible for designing and delivering activities for such events.
Expected to support the growth of the Energy Water and Resources Infrastructure Capability in Singapore.
What will I bring?
Recognized relevant tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering with minimum 3 years (post tertiary education) relevant industry experience in Civil Engineering with an emphasis on designing roads, drainage, water, sewer, WSUD, utilities and paving elements within a consulting business environment.
Minimum of 1 years’ experience delivering land development projects from pre-concept design to site phase for a range of clients including Local Government Authorities and/or Private Developers.
Knowledge and experience of Coastal Engineering as well as of aviation and rail projects is beneficial.
Experience in construction phase of projects and of Contract Administration.
Experience in the operation of software design tools including Bentley Systems, Infoworks, Civil3D or AutoCAD. In addition, experience using hydraulic modelling packages would be an advantage.
Our firm
Dedicated to sustainable development, the firm is a collective of 16,000 designers, advisors and experts working across 140 countries. Founded to be both humane and excellent, we collaborate with our clients and partners using imagination, technology and rigour to shape a better world.
We create spaces where everyone feels safe, seen and included and able to perform at their best. We take an approach to flexible working that supports the diversity and well-being of our members.
Are you ready to shape a better world?
Our open roles are waiting for you on the Arup careers page. If you like what you see here, apply today.
Arup does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: PROJECT ENGINEER (Geotechnical)
company_info: ZHAO YANG GEOTECHNIC PTE LTD was incorporated in 1997 as a local small enterprise specialising in ground improvement and geotechnical engineering works. We strive to continuously upgrade our capability through acquiring technology and to develop our staff competency so as to strengthen our market position and enhance our competitive edge in the industry. Since our inception, we have been specialising in a wide range of ground improvement and geotechnical engineering works which can be broadly categorized into ground improvement works and geotechnical engineering works. Over the years, we have transformed to become a leading ground improvement and geotechnical engineering specialist whom our clients can always trust for top quality and innovative ground engineering solutions. Our on-site experience gives us a competitive edge in anticipating client requirements. Our no-obligation assessment and consultancy service ensures precise evaluation of the customers’ requirements, providing competitive charges which enhance our competitive edge. As a trusted partner, we assist customers to achieve maximum operational efficiency and minimize downtime through a dedicated team of engineers, technicians, skilled workers who are operational ready 24 hours a day and seven days a week. As such, we have grown from strength to strength to become one of the market leaders in Singapore. Our outstanding product quality, service and competitive pricing have not only enabled us to retain our valued customers throughout the years, but also enable us to expand our customer base. Zhao Yang is proud to achieve ISO 9001 certification, OHSAS 18001:2007 certification and ISO 14001:2004 certification from Bureau Veritas Certification, which is a testament of our total commitment to the highest standard of products and service. Our products are manufactured under strict process governed by ISO9001:2008 Quality Management System and ISO14001:2004 UKAS Environment Management System. We are also recognized for our outstanding achievement in safety management systems and conferred by the Ministry of Manpower BizSAFE Star for our exemplary efforts to control workplace safety and health hazards to create a safe working environment for our workers. The principal clients of Zhao Yang are mainly from the government agencies, statutory boards, MNCs, SMEs, civil engineering specialists, developers, builders and construction companies.

title: Field Construction Engineer, Civil (Life Sciences)
company_info: Jacobs International Consultants Pte Ltd is an engineering consultancy firm. In Singapore, our business spans across Infrastructure (mainly Water and Transportations) and Advanced Facilities (Life Sciences, Biopharma, Pharmaceuticals, Semiconductor, and Data Centre) sectors. Globally we have 55,000 employees, which includes nearly 500 employees in Singapore. What drives you drives us as we work to build a better world together. At Jacobs, every day is an opportunity to make the world better, more connected, more sustainable. We’re powered by people across the globe who deliver innovative scientific, technical, professional and program management solutions for public and private clients around the world. ​We’re always looking for dynamic and engaged people to join our team. Bring your passion, your ingenuity and your vision. Let’s see the impact we can create, together.​
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At Jacobs, we push the limits of what’s possible to make the world smarter, more connected and more sustainable. In our life sciences work, that means designing spaces that foster innovation, cultivate collaboration and drive the next great discovery for humanity.
Our Jacobs Singapore team is currently hiring a new Field Construction Engineer to be part of the Life Sciences Team working on pharmaceutical projects. Main duties:
Assist the Construction Manager in the successful implementation of a specific discipline to the required quality/ specification. Carry out other activities as directed by the Site Manager from time to time to suit the needs of a particular Project.
Check that the latest drawings and related documents are available and report discrepancies, if any, to the concerned Superiors.
Ascertain whether any special instructions are to be observed for installation, testing of packages/ imported consignments as per recommendations of Package Suppliers.
Study, evaluate and establish construction sequences, considering complexity of the job, priorities / milestones as per client requirements and approved schedule. Highlight constraints or hold ups required for completion of milestones to the Site Manager for inter-discipline, discussions, keeping holds to a bare minimum to avoid delay in overall project programme.
Study and satisfy himself of the sufficiency and efficiency of construction schemes obtained from Contractor.
Arrange and witness tests of contractors works and materials (if required). Alternatively, scrutinize Certificates of Plant and Machinery / instruments used for safe Construction operations/ conduct tests at Site. Accept Certificates only from Standards / approved Test Houses.
Assist in arranging and carrying out fitness/ safe load tests of contractors plant and machinery; alternatively assist in scrutinising certificates of such plant and machinery for safe Construction operations at Site.
Maintain detailed record of milestone events and construction progress to enable Site Manager to compile/ issue Periodical Progress Reports and Closure Reports on Completion of Construction.
Verification and certification of contractors’ invoices as per contract document.
Assist the Site Manager/ Commissioning Engineers in carrying out re-commissioning and commissioning activities, as required.
Based on given overall programme, assist in establishing weekly / fortnightly programme in agreement with Contractor and conducting regular meetings with Contractors at pre-determined agreed intervals to assess achieved programme vis a vis scheduled programme. Assist in forecasting bottlenecks or any other problems, which may impede construction progress and advise concerned Officers for expediting for removal of bottlenecks. Monitor Contractors resources to achieve progress as planned.
Ensure all work within the assigned scope of responsibility is completed in accordance with the accepted project plan and within the work-hour budget allocated.
Monitor Contractors resources to achieve progress as planned.
Meet client expectations and maintain long-term relationship with client. Attend to client’s feedback and any complaints.
Co-ordinate & assist the Client's Representatives in negotiations on Construction requirements of the Clients Construction Sub-Contracts.
Ensure that the contractors comply with the site working conditions and the Client's regulations for Fire, Safety and Security.
Ensure that the applicable Statutory and other Legal requirements are properly observed.
Adhere to the Company's Policies for the employment of Labour and ensure that all matters concerning Labour relations are dealt with in accordance with the Labour Agreements.
Maintain active contact with all Phases of Construction work and assign specific duties to all personnel under his Supervision to maintain Construction Progress in accordance with the Schedule.
Ensure that the Plant is constructed to the Drawings, Specifications, Applicable Standards, and Good Construction Practices & to Schedule and maintain records for final documentation.
To be a successful candidate, you shall possess:
Minimum Diploma in Civil Engineering
Experience in the Construction of Chemical or Pharmaceutical projects; piling and open foundations for Buildings, Structures, and Equipment foundations; water retaining structure; finishing items related to the Building Works
Jacobs. A world where you can.
From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.
With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs. Jacobs complies with the Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices (TGFEP), including the prevailing guidelines on recruitment. All qualified applicants will be considered for the position regardless of age, race, religion, language, nationality, marital status, or family responsibilities.

title: Project Engineer
company_info: Sato Kogyo traces its roots to one of the oldest turnkey contractors in Japan. Established in 1862 and headquartered in Tokyo, Sato Kogyo laid the cornerstone of modern building technology by focusing on and developing newer and more efficient construction methodologies that are still relevant around the world today. Over a rich history of more than 140 years, Sato Kogyo has accomplished numerous types of building and civil engineering projects of varying scale, nature and complexity from Japan to United States, Singapore to Malaysia and Thailand to China. In 1972, the firm recognised the growing construction activities in the Asia Pacific region and spreaded its wings beyond the shores of Japan. Expanding rapidly in response to its success, Sato Kogyo set up offices in Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok and Xi’an. The strength of the Singapore Office has evolved into a Regional Headquarters in 2002 to oversee the emerging East Asian markets.

· Manage and oversee the day-to-day construction activities on the site, ensuring that work is progressing as per the project schedule and plans

title: Utility Engineer
company_info: The COENS Group is an integrated services provider headquartered in Busan, South Korea since 1999. Our over 20 years of experience in managing and executing workforce solutions and other technical services for international projects make us an ideal partner of Clients, placing us as a top integrated services provider in South Korea. Our prowess lies in furnishing tailored project solutions to organizations involved in the delivery of some of the world’s largest and most complex projects with a particular expertise in providing full project teams. With over 16 offices in strategic locations in Asia and beyond, COENS is staffed with industry specialists backed with many years of relevant experience in the provision of recruitment, destination mobility services and project site support to Clients in key industries. COENS has operational offices in over 6 countries worldwide including South Korea, China, Singapore, Myanmar, Russia, and USA. Our depth and presence in these strategic locations stamps our territory to ably yield to client’s needs on a local, regional and global level. With trusted know-how in project support, COENS expanded our field to various sectors by establishing associated offices and entities. COENS Energy Pte Ltd. in Singapore is a licensed Employment Agency. Its industry experienced staff provides manpower services to Clients in various sectors such as Oil and Gas, Chemical, ICT, Civil Infrastructure, Building Construction, and Financial Services. In more recent years, it has provided technical recruitment, contractor management, tailored project solutions, and assignment support services through its highly experienced delivery teams.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Coordination with Utility agencies
Review, plan, and schedule site activities for diversion work.
Selection and management of sub-contractors for diversion services.
Management of document submission and obtaining of approvals from the relevant authorities for diversion works such as NCE
Coordination with Authorities for the diversion of traffic during the relocation of utility services

Carry out periodic site inspections during the construction period in order to ensure the works near the utility services are proceeding according to the agreed procedure and also ensure utility markers are in place to prevent utility damage from occurring on site.
Liaise with the construction/design team for making proposals for the reinstatement of services and coordinate with relevant utility agencies for reinstatement work.

Fluent speaking and coordination skills
Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines and requires minimum supervision

title: Design Engineer
company_info: SAM WOO (S.E.A.) PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Descriptions
Gather inputs on design requests from Engineering Managers.
Discuss design schemes, seek clarifications and provide information about engineering design aspects.
Prepare drawings / sketches with CAD team and resolve queries.
Approve final drawings, prepare design calculations and present to Engineering Manager.
Review, interpret and report results of all geotechnical instrumentation in accordance with the Instrumentation & Monitoring Generalised Plan of Action.
Guide engineers to execute design requests from Engineering Managers.
Develop and maintain design management tools for tracking, reporting and monitoring the progress and delivery of design packages.
Identify design delays at the earliest stage, investigate causes and proactively seek to mitigate any adverse impacts on procurement, fabrication, and construction.
Verify permanent works designs meets Client’s specifications.
Liaise with the Client/Engineer and external parties for their feedback where applicable.
Monitor progress of work, check design for completion and efficiency by reviewing design calculations.
Review all designs for compliance with engineering principles and relevant design codes.
Ensure that all drawings are in adherence with CAD standards and company’s operating procedures.
Proactively seek to optimise temporary works solutions, by eliminating risks during construction, maximising temporary works reuse and ensuring practical constructability.
Collaborate with designers and site operations teams to seek consensus on engineering solutions.
Conduct engineering reviews for tenders, post award / permanent works design by external consultants.
Engage with consultants, provide inputs, and seek clarifications.
Address critical concerns, resolve issues and provide solutions to Engineering Manager.
Facilitate collaboration between stakeholders to complete engineering design reviews and enhance efficiency.

2-3 years of working experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering

title: Senior Installation Engineer
company_info: EP2C ENERGY SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
address: THE CENTRAL, 8 EU TONG SEN STREET 059818
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Daily activities
Your tasks and responsibilities include the following:
· Develop execution methods for offshore projects, selection of required equipment, concept and detail design of lifting arrangements etc.
· Perform engineering, technical project preparation and execution support of offshore projects, i.e. heavy lift installation projects.
· Review and organize review of internal and external deliverables (drawings, reports and procedures).
· Prepare and coordinate subcontractor Scope of Works.

Who will you work with?
The Installation Engineer (Senior) is member of the Technology Department. You will work in a team with other engineers in various disciplines and actively liaise with colleagues in other departments, like procurement, fabrication, operations, logistics etc.

Is this the job for you?
You are a team player who organizes and plans the work and the involvement of others effectively and efficiently. You are quality and result oriented and have the ability to adapt easily when needed. Next to this you take the different interests of different divisions of the organization and mutual relations into account. You recognize the effects and results of your own decisions or activities on other parts of the organization.

Furthermore, you have:
· A Bachelor and/or Masters degree in Offshore Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Similar.
· A minimum of 2 years or 5 years (senior) of experience in engineering, project preparation and execution of offshore projects.
· Excellent analytical, practical and pragmatic skills.
· Good communication skills in English, both spoken and written.
· Supervisory and coaching skills to provide guidance to less experienced engineers.
· The ambition to work (temporarily) offshore on our vessels, overseas or in our other offices.

Tialoc provides a comprehensive suite of service offerings, from consulting and planning, design and engineering to turnkey equipment design and fabrication, including installation, commissioning, operation and maintenance. title: Senior Structural Engineer
company_info: EP2C ENERGY SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
address: THE CENTRAL, 8 EU TONG SEN STREET 059818
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Senior Structural Engineer you will provide structural support for studies, tenders commercial projects and internal business development products.
You will have the opportunity to go offshore on our vessels and see your designs and work in action, supporting our fleet with anything that requires a bright technical mind and pro-active attitude.

Daily activities
Your tasks and responsibilities include the following:
· Perform concept detail design of offshore lifting arrangements and steel structures, such as lifting appliances, lift points, lift arrangements and grillage and seafastening.
· Perform structural hand calculations and prepare technical design reports.
· Perform structural strength verification analyses, including Finite Element Analysis, by use of software packages such as SACS and ABAQUS.
· Review structural deliverables (construction reports and drawings).
· Perform quality control on deliverables prepared by colleagues.
· Contribute to a continuously improving and learning organization by i.e. actively sharing knowledge and experience and identifying and providing follow up subjects for improvement.

Is this the job for you?
You are a team player who organizes and plans your own work and the involvement of others effectively and efficiently. You are quality and result oriented and have the ability to adapt easily when needed. You also take the interests of different divisions of the organization and mutual relations into account on your own initiative. You also have an awareness of the various aspects of the work, which will have a direct impact on the managers and decision makers within the organization.

Furthermore, you have:
· A Bachelor and/or Masters degree in Offshore Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Similar.
· A minimum of 5 years of experience in engineering, project preparation and execution of offshore projects.
· A good understanding of offshore structural engineering.
· Excellent analytical, practical and pragmatic skills.
· Good communication skills in English, both spoken and written.
· Supervisory and coaching skills to provide guidance to less experienced engineers.
· The ambition to work (temporarily) at yards, offshore on our vessels or in our other offices.

Required competencies
· High technical proficiency in structural discipline
· Teamwork
· Organizational sensitivity
· Quality orientation
· Taking ownership

title: Instrumentation Engineer
company_info: Element is one of the fastest growing testing, inspection and certification businesses in the world. Globally we have more than 7,500 brilliant minds operating from 200 sites across 30 countries. Together we share an ambitious purpose to ‘Make tomorrow safer than today’. When failure in use is not an option, we help customers make certain that their products, materials, processes and services are safe, compliant and fit for purpose. From early R&D, through complex regulatory approvals and into production, our global laboratory network of scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers to achieve assurance over product quality, sustainable outcomes, and market access. While we are proud of our global reach, working at Element feels like being part of a smaller company. We empower you to take charge of your career, and reward excellence and integrity with growth and development. Industries across the world depend on our care, attention to detail and the absolute accuracy of our work. The role we have to play in creating a safer world is much bigger than our organization. Over the past 12 years, it has carried out a large number of projects and term contracts for private sector and Singapore government such as marine deep-water soil investigation for JTC and jetty, hydrofracture, pressuremeter, packer, deep borehole imaging and temperature tests, geophysicals and inclined drilling for deep tunnel project, slope investigation term contract for HDB and PUB, special lab tests for soils and rocks (in UK), real-time noise and vibration monitoring, inclinometers, recharge wells, automated tunnel monitoring, automated strain gauge monitoring for deep excavation, large-scale underground water level monitoring, and bridge and building strengthening using carbon fibres, etc.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Element has an opportunity for Instrumentation Engineer for Singapore
In this role, you will be primarily responsible for assisting in designing, planning, and coordinating geotechnical instrumentation projects, scheduling control, obtaining permits for on-site installation, and setting up and commissioning monitoring
This will be a site based position in Singapore

Core Responsibilities
Propose engineering documents for clients' approval, on-site installation and hands-on monitoring of sensors, instruments, and equipment
Instruct supervise, manage, and monitor site personnel ensuring data processing, review , analysis, submission of reports
Attending project meetings, schedule control, submit for permits for on-site installation, set up, and commission monitoring

Liaise and coordinate with client for installation and monitoring issues while overseeing all instrumentation works including production of method statements, project quality plan, calibration, installation, data acquisition, data verification, data processing, web database, data presentation, update of instrumentation drawings and reporting

Degree in Civil Engineering or Geology recognised by the PE Board along with 3 years relevant experience in major infrastructure projects
Working experience in geotechnical instrumentation and site investigation works
Physically fit and able to withstand the challenging working conditions
Strong and determined quality focus with indefatigable determination to get the job done under the most challenging conditions
Self-motivated team player with excellent organisational and communication skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose
The primary role of this position is to assist Engineer/ Senior Engineer in performing of all engineering work within the subsea pipeline/ structural discipline engineering team for the assigned projects. The role shall also include providing support to Engineer/ Senior Engineer in ensuring the technical adequacy and quality of engineering work produced and proper coordination and communication with other disciplines for completion of all assigned work of the Project.
Specific Responsibilities
Assist in the preparation of design premise and/or Basis of Design (BoD) for projects, including but not limited to, collation, review and update of information and/or data, etc
Assist in performance of engineering activities and preparation of deliverables as directed by Engineer/ Senior Engineer, including not limited to, the following:
Collate all relevant engineering input data.
Perform engineering modelling, analyses and simulations.
Prepare analysis/ calculation reports, drawings, sketches, MTOs, schedules, registers etc., in compliance with the BoD.
Assist in performance of engineering activities and preparation of deliverables as per Worley Management System as directed by Senior/ Lead Engineer.
Assist in performance of engineering activities and preparation of deliverables in compliance with engineering standards, customer specifications and requirements as directed by Engineer/ Senior Engineer.
Assist in the implementation of Quality Assurance system requirements to ensure engineering delivery quality and consistency.
Qualifications - Internal
Essential Skills/ Experience
Basic knowledge of the oil & gas industry with an keen interest in building a career in the industry.
Good understanding in engineering design of steel structures for both offshore applications and/or onshore (land).
Basic understanding on the use industrial practices and international codes and standards, such as DNV, ASME, API, ISO, etc., and their applications in engineering design.
Basic understanding of Python or equivalent programming and the use of software and tools for engineering design.
Ability and willingness to learn new skills and knowledge.
Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work with others as part of a team.
Proficient in the English language, both written and spoken, with some experience in preparation of engineering reports.
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil/structural or Mechanical Engineering, or higher academic achievements in the relevant field.

Leica Geosystems is best known for its broad array of products that capture accurately, model quickly, analyze easily, and visualize and present spatial information. Those who use Leica products every day trust them for their dependability, the value they deliver, and the superior customer support. Based in Heerbrugg, Switzerland, Leica Geosystems is a global company with tens of thousands of customers supported by more than 3,500 employees in 28 countries and hundreds of partners located in more than 120 countries around the world. Responsibilities
· Responsible for facility inspection, maintenance and repair of areas outside the production plants. The scope includes the Operations Building, Laboratory, Maintenance Offices/ Workshops, Chemical Warehouse, Spare Parts Warehouse, Canteen, yards, streets and parking lots, dikes and ditches, contractor area, all developed land, fences, gates, barriers and signs.
· Responsible and knowledgeable of the critical safety systems fire protection (includes hazardous chemical storage) surveillance, security access and lift systems. All system must be maintained according for government and EMSEA regulations and standards by regular inspections as required by law. The Facility Engineer will plan and supervise contractor’s execution of activities. In urgent cases, that have an impact on the production availability call-in is required.
· Contributes to maintain and administer facility quality, safety and environmental programs/processes, including non-conformance action items and MOC processes. He/she therefore is in close contact with the relevant departments to be up to date in terms of regulations.
· Responsible to operate and repair all HVAC and Building Management System (BMS) issue using contract labor. Laboratory safety systems and main infrastructure equipment will be maintained and repaired at all times. Responsible and knowledgeable of all plumbing and sewer systems in all non-production areas.
· Manage and facilitate preventive maintenance, cleaning, and servicing of all non-production building, streets, parking lots and yards. Must provide oversight for confined space, work at height Supervisor and Risk Assessments for the performance of work.
· Responsible for contract and work order management. Use SAP R11 and Ri-Source systems for tracking, execution and payment of work. Contract renewal bid package construction, review, edit and updates. Provides bid oversight for all Facilities management contracts. Ensure work quality by supervision and performs random checks.

Contracts Responsibility is as listed, but not limited to the following: Fire Alarm, Security Systems, HVAC, Laboratory Infrastructure, Road/ Drainage.
· Inter-act with government agencies for reporting and inspections. Create and manage small capital project initiatives for compliance or asset preservation initiatives.

company_info: MAEK CONSULTING PTE. LTD. Mission - Services for a Sustainable World MAEK Consulting prides itself as an innovative third party specialist consultant providing technical supporting services to ensure sustainable asset management and development. The firm is built upon a foundation of dedicated team of multi-disciplined specialists including material engineers, chemists, architects, mechanical engineers, civil and structural engineers, geologists and environmental scientists. Working within the realm of ever inquisitive environment, we strive to provide innovative solutions to problems from design to construction as well as the long term maintenance of the buildings including ensuring the health of the built environment. In our works, we take into consideration both the economic and environmental sustainability of the development and asset. job_category: Building and Construction, Consulting, Engineering, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Experiential Opportunities
1) Manage and execute engineering consultancy projects related to building assessment for diagnosis and conservation purpose, specifically related to civil and structural engineering.
2) Carry out site/building investigation work, site testing, visual inspection & non-destructive testing. Assessment of structural integrity of structures.
3) Heritage conservation involving architectural and structural aspects. Carry out investigation and assessment to propose conservation strategies and methods.
4) Consolidation of results, technical report writing and presentation.
5) Development of tender documents, carry out tendering activities and project management.

Qualifications & Pre-requisites
1) Bachelor/Master Degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering and related engineering field
2) Knowledge of building technology, architectural materials and construction processes are required.
3) Familiar with building components and materials, building services, civil engineering structures etc.
4) Experience with Non-destructive testing methods (infra red thermography, ultrasonic pulse echo, ground penetrating radar etc), geophysics would be advantageous.
5) Keen intrest in building assessment, building diagnosis and heritage conservation.

An Ideal Consultant
1) Able to work promptly under tight schedule. Keen to learn, conduct research and investigative work
2) Provide recommendations and Project mangement.
3) Independent, comfortable to communicate with various parties, analytical skill, photography and competent with computer applications
4) Proactive, initiative and exhibit passion during work.
5) Quick thinking, motivated, goal driven and comfortable taking lead.
6) Demostrated ability to multitask and is detail oriented with inquisitive mind during work
7) Good team player with strong communication skills with project teams, senior management, and contractors including both technical and non-technical personnel.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About our client: Our client is a leading Construction and Civil Engineering company supporting the Oil & Gas and Chemical Processing Industries.

About the role:
Support the accomplishment of construction human resource objectives by selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising job contributions; recommending compensation actions; adhering to policies and procedures.
Act as the main technical adviser on project site for subcontractors, crafts people and operatives;
Checking plans, drawings and quantities for execution and monitoring of works on site
Ensuring that all materials used are delivered timely, and work performed are as per specifications with quality and executed safely
Overseeing the selection and requisition of materials and plant; to ensure timely delivery and mobilization
Making cost-effective solutions and proposals for the intended project / works scope;
Managing, monitoring and interpreting the contract design documents/ drawings supplied by the client, architect or consultant;
Liaising with any Clients, consultants, subcontractors, vendors, supervisors, planners, quantity surveyors and the general workforce involved in the project;
Liaising with the local authority (where appropriate to the project) to ensure compliance with local construction regulations and by-laws;
Liaising with clients and their representatives (architects, engineers and surveyors), including attending regular meetings to keep them informed of progress;
Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site supervisory staff, labour force and the work of any subcontractors;
Accomplishes construction project results by defining project purpose and scope; calculating resources required; establishing standards and protocols; allocating resources; scheduling and coordinating staff and sub-contractors; evaluating milestone assumptions and conclusions; resolving design problems; evaluating and implementing change orders.
Updates job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging construction practices and standards; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Submission of required documents for the project/ work scope including (but not limited to) method statement, project schedule, execution plan, etc.
Planning the work and efficiently organizing the plant and site facilities in order to meet agreed deadlines;
Overseeing quality control and health and safety matters on site;
Preparing reports as required;
Resolving any unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise.
Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
Upholding Company’s work ethics and proper display of representation to Clients/Vendors/Subcon

Min degree in Civil Engineering

title: Engineer
company_info: Element is one of the fastest growing testing, inspection and certification businesses in the world. Globally we have more than 7,500 brilliant minds operating from 200 sites across 30 countries. Together we share an ambitious purpose to ‘Make tomorrow safer than today’. When failure in use is not an option, we help customers make certain that their products, materials, processes and services are safe, compliant and fit for purpose. From early R&D, through complex regulatory approvals and into production, our global laboratory network of scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers to achieve assurance over product quality, sustainable outcomes, and market access. While we are proud of our global reach, working at Element feels like being part of a smaller company. We empower you to take charge of your career, and reward excellence and integrity with growth and development. Industries across the world depend on our care, attention to detail and the absolute accuracy of our work. The role we have to play in creating a safer world is much bigger than our organization. Over the past 12 years, it has carried out a large number of projects and term contracts for private sector and Singapore government such as marine deep-water soil investigation for JTC and jetty, hydrofracture, pressuremeter, packer, deep borehole imaging and temperature tests, geophysicals and inclined drilling for deep tunnel project, slope investigation term contract for HDB and PUB, special lab tests for soils and rocks (in UK), real-time noise and vibration monitoring, inclinometers, recharge wells, automated tunnel monitoring, automated strain gauge monitoring for deep excavation, large-scale underground water level monitoring, and bridge and building strengthening using carbon fibres, etc.

Today, we are Singapore’s largest privately owned construction and civil engineering specialist, with a dedicated 1,000-strong workforce, and a body of work spanning many of Singapore’s most notable and iconic developments. At the heart of our four-generation family-run business lies a proud heritage of industry, integrity and enterprise, focused on creating lasting value for our clients, improving quality and safety standards on every project, and maximising opportunities for our employees to achieve their career potential. These values have fueled the company’s growth consistently for more than 80 years, and continue to do so. In our efforts to continuously raise the industry bar, we seek to introduce innovative new building solutions and broaden our skills through strategic joint-venture partnerships with overseas counterparts. This has seen us emerge in recent years from being a principal player in the building of private residential and commercial developments, to becoming a leader too in large-scale civil engineering works, cementing our position at the forefront of the construction industry, locally and regionally.

title: Civil & Structural Design Engineer
company_info: From its inception in the year 1997 JPL Consultants Pte Ltd has grown steadily, delivering architectural, civil and structural engineering projects of increasing complexity and value in Singapore and major cities around the world. JPL has developed a systematic approach in fulfilling development needs by offering services in civil and structural engineering, project supervision and management, and appraisals to name a few. As the years have gone by, JPL has gotten the reputation of providing receptive and effective, on time, and within budget quality service. We pride ourselves in being able to meet our clients' ever changing needs. Highly motivated and experienced, JPL qualified professionals are skilled and confident to adhere to our clients’ requirement. To cater for our client’s need in China, JPL established a subsidiary office in Shenyang in year 2007. It has grown into sizeable professional practices that not only serves projects in China, but support our HQ’s project when needed. JPL Consultants is dedicated to expanding itself as a major consultancy firm here in Singapore as well as in China, not only in the provision of architecture, civil and structural consultancy services, but also in project management. Our target is to become a competitive agency in the Asian Market. Currently, JPL Consultants service a wide range of clients in Singapore. We involved in projects ranging from media, private housing, industrial, government as well as educational institutions. In celebration of our 10th year in civil engineering consultancy services, JPL Consultants opened our 1st subsidiary in Shenyang, China in 2007. We are extremely pleased that our subsidiary is going strong and have been involved in a number of high profile projects. JPL Consultants have also been involved in a number of big oversea projects such as Dubai International Airport, India Jaipur International Airport and Malaysia Kota Kinabalu Airport. In Singapore, JPL Consultants is currently involved in the IR at Sentosa as well as a number of upgrading works to various army camps across Singapore. We are dedicated to continuing our good work, and hope to provide our expertise to more clients in the near future.

title: ASSISTANT / PRODUCTION ENGINEER
company_info: Greyform Pte Ltd, a member of Straits Construction Group, is incorporated in December 2015 to offer Precast and Prefabricated solutions to the construction industry. Operating from Greyform Building, the business focusses on providing building solutions that enable productivity improvement together with enhancement to quality and safety aspect of the construction industry. We capitalize on digital technology and automation for long term competitiveness, and aims to transform the traditional industry by injecting youth and new skills for the future economy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
1. JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title
Assistant Production Engineer

Job Description & Requirements

Overview

As an Production Engineer (Senior / Assistant), you will assist the Production Manager in managing the Overall Operation of Precast Cconstruction Plant. You are to adhere to Quality, Environmental, Safety Management System in accordance with Company’s standards and customers’ requirements.

Responsibilities

1) Identifies operational problems by observing and studying system functioning and performance results; investigating complaints and suggestions; interviewing process supervisors and operators; completing troubleshooting procedures.

2) Identifies operational priorities by assessing operational objectives; determining project objectives, such as, efficiency, cost savings, energy conservation, operator convenience, safety, environmental quality; estimating relevance, time, and costs.

3) Develops operational solutions by defining, studying, estimating, and screening alternative solutions; calculating economics; determining impact on total system.

4) Anticipates operational problems by studying operating targets, modes of operation, limitations & performance.

5) Improves operational quality results by studying, evaluating, and recommending process re-design; implementing changes; contributing information and opinion to improve productivity performance.

6) Provides operational management information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing operating and engineering data and trends.

7) Maintains safe and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.

8) Participate in reviewing Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Risk Assessment to ensure its effectiveness.

9) Participate in investigation of EHS incident and recommend preventive measure.

10) Authorize to stop production relating to Safety, Environmental or Efficiency issue not complying to Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Management System or Procedure.

11) Verify that solutions agreed for problems relating to non-conformities relating to product process and Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Healthsystem are implemented.

12) Review and recommend the disposition of the rejected in-coming raw material, work-in-process and finished goods.

13) Review and endorse Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health System Procedure.

14) Manage, coach and train the team members which include carrying out performance review and disciplinary action, if required.

15) Perform any other duties as assigned by the Management and the designated manager.

Requirements

1) Minimum ITE
a) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineering
b) 5 years’ experience working as Engineer or 8 years’ as Technician in a manufacturing environment

2) Diploma in Engineering
a) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineering
b) 2 years’ experience working as Engineer in a manufacturing environment

3) Preferably with knowledge of manufacturing and assembling of Precasting.

4) Knowledge of ISO 9001, 14001 & 45001 standards and AutoCAD will be advantages.

5) Knowledge in Safety Management is a must.

6) IT savvy with proficient in Microsoft Office application.

7) Possess leadership and supervisory skills with manpower planning experiences.

8) Possess problem-solving, analyzing and reporting skills.

9) Possess good interpersonal skills and excellent team spirit.

10) Independent with high level of initiative and fast learner.

11) Meticulous and positive attitude in learning.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A multi-disciplinary engineering and design consultancy firm is looking for a Strutural Specialist (Coastal Engineering) in Singapore.

Responsibilities:
Work with design & project teams to identify technical issues for the projects and provide technical solutions pertaining to structural for coastal projects
Propose practical approach to solve new technical problems encountered in projects adopting latest research development or using modifications of established procedures or methods
Carry out 2D/3D structural modelling for complex structural problems
Provide support to the design and planning project team in addressing structural problem
Perform independent and collaborative research to meet the project and research objectives related to coastal and reclamation
Communicate with relevant agencies and industry partners to identify the key research areas

Requirements:
10+ years of research and working experience as a Structural Engineer
PhD Degree in Structural/Civil Engineering or any related disciplines
Sound technical knowledge in structural engineering in various fields such as steel, concrete, frame structures etc. (related to coastal engineering projects)
Team player for collaborative research and project purposes
Strong communication skills for reporting and presentation internally/externally
Working / research experience as structural engineer of at least 10 years
Experience in data analysis and AI would be an advantage
Familiar with design software related to Structural Engineering

Interested applicants, kindly apply with your latest CV and we will get in touch with you. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Project Manager (Planning & Design) - Coastal Engineering
company_info: PHAIDON INTERNATIONAL (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD Securing business-critical talent across Financial Services, Life Sciences, Infrastructure, Supply Chain and Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A multi-disciplinary engineering and design consultancy firm is looking for a Project Manager (Planning & Design) - Coastal Engineering in Singapore.

Responsibilities:
Oversee and manage the project management processes for engineering and construction works related to coastal engineering
Manage project control, schedules, cost and risk.
Implement integrated Project Management Information Systems and use of industry standard tools and software platforms for project control.
Cross-collaboration and facilitation between project design teams, clients and to achieve project objectives and goals.
Periodic forecast, reporting and updates on project progress
Manage a team of Design and Project Engineers during the design stage.

Requirements:
Bachelor or Master's Degree in Civil Engineering recognized by BCA/IES/ACES.
10+ years of experience in large infrastructure projects/reclamation projects with at least 5 years as a project manager or project control manager in Singapore.
Excellent analytical thinking skills and problem solving abilities.
Collaborative and team player mentality
Well-versed in Microsoft Office Suite of Software (e.g. Word, PowerPoint, Excel etc)
Experience in contract administration will be advantageous

Interested applicants, kindly apply with your latest CV and we will get in touch with you. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: SENIOR ELECTRICAL ENGINEER

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A renowned company that operates the world's largest transshipment hub.
Be part of a dynamic team for engineering systems and equipment.
About Our Client
A leading transshipment cargo company, with strategic operations in Singapore and the world. Equipped with state-of-the-art technologies and systems, the company offers a wide range of services, from warehousing, logistics and freight forwarding.Committed on delivering quality services, innovation and contributing to the industry's development.
Job Description
Key Responsibilities:
Lead and oversee the planning, design, and execution of M&E projects, including but not limited to electrical systems, power distribution, lighting, and control systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including architects, civil engineers, and project managers, to ensure seamless project integration and completion.
Conduct technical feasibility studies and provide recommendations for electrical system enhancements, upgrades, and replacements.
Develop and review detailed electrical engineering drawings, specifications, and technical documentation.
Perform engineering calculations, simulations, and analyses to ensure optimal system performance.
Ensure compliance with relevant codes, standards, and regulations in electrical engineering and safety.
Evaluate and select appropriate electrical equipment, materials, and suppliers.
Manage project budgets, timelines, and resources to ensure on-time and within-budget project delivery.
Supervise and mentor junior electrical engineers and technicians.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex electrical issues and system failures.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in electrical engineering.
The Successful Applicant
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in electrical engineering with a focus on M&E projects.
Strong knowledge of electrical design, power distribution, lighting, and control systems.
Familiarity with relevant codes and standards.
Excellent project management and leadership skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality and safety.
What's on Offer
You will be working in a industry leading company that creates focuses on creating new possibilities and foster building great teams. To have the flexibility and opportunities to grow with the chance to create culture for the innovation of the future.

description:
